Por sus cualidades sus vecinos lo admiran porque a pesar delas adversidades de la vida siempre se ha trabajado y ha sido responsable con sus hijos y su esposa. José se dedica a la labor de ser agricultor cultiva los principales granos básicos de la zona como son maíz y frijol, y así va sufragando las necesidades de su hogar. José desea seguir cultivando y vendiendo es por eso que se acercó a INTEGRAL para solicitar un crédito para comprar insumos agrícolas como: Semillas, Abonos, Fertilizantes, pesticidas etc. Desea contar con la ayuda y de ante mano deja claro que espera saldar la deuda antes de lo previsto.
texts.en:
José, age 40, lives with his family, his wife, and his children.  He is a very enterprising man.  He has always been known for being the one who is mainly responsible for his household’s daily bread.

His neighbors admire him for his virtues.  In spite of life’s adversities, he has always worked, and he has been responsible for his wife and children.

José is a farmer.  He grows the main basic grains in the area like corn and beans.  That is how he covers the necessities for his household.

José wishes to continue growing and selling.  That is why he approached INTEGRAL to request a loan.  He will use the loan to buy seeds, manure, fertilizer, and pesticide, etc.  He wishes to have the help.  He leaves it clear in advance that he hopes to get out of debt earlier than anticipated.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies like seeds, manure, fertilizer, and pesticide, etc.

loans.name: Rayisomzita Group

texts.fr:
Mme MADINA est responsable du groupe RAYISOMZITA. Elle se porte bien. Mariée, elle est mère de 03 enfants. Le plus âgé a 13ans et le moins âgé a 02ans et quelques mois. Deux(02) vont à l’école et elle a  03 personnes en charge.

 Mme vend du sucre, du sel et du savon depuis 11 ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans les grandes boutiques de son secteur. Ses clients sont celles qui font les jus, les galettes et la bouillie. 

Elle veut s’acheter 05 sacs de sucre de 50kg, 05 sacs de sel de 25kg. 

Elle épargne ses bénéfices afin de renforcer. Mme ambitionne agrandir son activité en ouvrant une boutique et assurer la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Madina is the representative of the RAYISOMZITA group. She is doing well. She is the married mother of three children aged 2 to 13, two of whom go to school. She is supporting three people.

Madina has been selling sugar, salt and soap for eleven years. She buys her stock at the large shops of the area. Her customers are those who prepare juices, flat cakes and porridge.

She wants to buy five 50 kg bags of sugar, and five 25 kg bags of salt.

She saves her profits to bolster her business. She plans to expand her activity by opening a shop, and she wants to support her children's tuition.

loans.use: to buy five 50 kg bags of sugar, and five 25 kg bags of salt.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en: Asha is taking out another Kiva loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to boost her business. Her dream had always been to have a well-supplied general store in order to be able to generate more income and thus be able to have a better quality of life for her and her whole family. With her effort, work and dedication, she has succeeded, reaching her goals without any type of problem. Today, Asha has the shop she dreamed of and she is requesting this loan in order to be able to supply it with drinks, food products, vegetables, milk and more. She is grateful for this opportunity that she is receiving.

loans.use: to supply her store with stock such as drinks, food products, vegetables and milk.

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en:
Khadija has been in business for years, running a charcoal store that is well stocked. She is a person who stands out on account of her desire to work and succeed through her business. She always strives to achieve success so as to help her family. 

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy more sacks of charcoal so she can satisfy her customers. She is grateful to Yehu Microfinance and Kiva for this opportunity, as it will be of great help to her.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Bibi

texts.en: Bibi is taking out another Kiva loan of Kes 25,000 to buy more bundles of handbags and clothes for resale. She dreams of expanding her retail shop to a boutique. She thanks Yehu Microfinance and Kiva for the opportunity.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of handbags and clothes for resale.

loans.name: Migena

texts.en:
Migena is requesting a loan to repair some doors and windows and a loan of 50,000 Albanian Lek will be enough to achieve that.

Migena, in her thirties, is an Egyptian woman who is married and has two children who are attending public school. They live in a major city in southern Albania in their community. While her husband has a job and works every day, she has been a stay-at-home mom for years now since there were no work opportunities for her. Nevertheless, Migena has been enjoying taking care of her family, so far.

“I wish I had a job so I could provide financially for my family, yet, what I have been doing all these years,is been more fulfilling to me and I wouldn’t change that for anything else,” she said smiling.

loans.use: to repair the doors of their family house

loans.name: Montaha

texts.en:
Montaha is a 47-year-old married woman, mother of one child. She has been working in the agriculture business for eight years as an additional income business, to increase family's income and improve their living standards. 

Montaha has a cow which is her only business and source of livelihood. She works at selling milk on daily basis to make a daily income.

She is applying for her third cycle loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua, in order to exchange her present cow for a small one since the present one has been consumed to the maximum. She will buy another one to increase her production and income.

Montaha is dreaming of having a big farm in the future, that will sure develop her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to replace her present cow and buy a new one

loans.name: Leyli

texts.en:
Leyli is from Stepanavan town. She lives with her husband and son and jointly with them, Leyli is involved in agriculture. They keep livestock which currently includes 2 cows, 2 pigs, 20 chickens and 2 colonies of bees. Leyli also owns a plot of agricultural land where she grows nuts, apples and pear trees. The whole family works hard to gather a good harvest and sell it in the local markets. 

The main income of the family comes from agriculture so Leyli would like to expand it. She needs some financial support to purchase a tractor and start cultivating land. This will enable her to grow different types of vegetables and will significantly increase her income. So she has applied for this loan to pay for a tractor.

She hopes that with the help of this loan she will be able to improve her agricultural business and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for a tractor

loans.name: Lonah

texts.en:
Lonah, a 38-year-old married mother of five, has been operating a food stall for the past 10 years. She also practices farming. A God-fearing, humble and hardworking lady, she describes her business as thriving. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, she has become financially stable.

Lonah is requesting a loan of 20,857 KES to buy more oranges, bananas, lemons, tomatoes, maize and beans. She hopes to be a rich and independent woman.

loans.use: to buy oranges, bananas, lemons, tomatoes, maize and beans.

loans.name: Kenneth

texts.en:
Hardworking and committed to his work, Kenneth, 33 years old, has owned a chemist (pharmacy) for the past three years. Kenneth describes his customers as very loyal and understanding. He also practices farming.

Kenneth is requesting a loan of 32,298 KES to buy a stock of pain killers, sanitary towels, cough syrups and antibiotics. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has learned how to save his money for future purposes. Someday he hopes to own a big farm and be a millionaire.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of pain killers, sanitary towels, cough syrups and antibiotics.

loans.name: Bernice's Group

texts.en:
Bernice's group is made up of four members who have been accessing loans from ID-Ghana since 2010. Their names are Borkor, Bernice, Henrieta and Joshua and they sell goods such as maize (corn), fabrics and other provisions. ID Ghana has been of great service to them since they have been able to grow their small businesses through the credit scheme. 

Bernice is a 32-year-old trader who is a single parent with two children. She has five years experience and works from Monday to Saturday selling materials which are used to make ladies and children's dresses. She is constantly working to improve her business capital. This is her third loan with ID-Ghana and she is requesting an amount of 400 Ghana shillings (GHS) to buy more goods for her customers in the community.

The entire group needs a total amount of 1,550 GHS for business expansion and to meet customer demand.

loans.use: to buy more materials to sell

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex is 23 years old and married. He owns a video shop and has been in business for the past two years. He also owns a retail shop. He describes his business as very busy. He is very hardworking, trustworthy and honest. Since he became a client of Faulu Kenya, he has increased his profits, and this has enabled him expand his business. 

Someday he hopes to be a successful businessman. He requires a loan of 37,513 KES (Kenyan shillings) to buy two television sets.

loans.use: to buy two television sets.

loans.name: Benedict

texts.en: Benedict is grateful that you lent him money to do business. He has improved his operations but would like to do more. The demand for his services has increased, and he intends to buy more machines. Benedict  is applying for a loan of 41,850 Kenya shillings to buy another dry-cleaning machine.

loans.use: To buy a dry-cleaning machine.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice has requested a third loan to help her pay the school fees for her daughter, who is in her fourth year in the secondary school. Her business is doing well, and she is still in the process of expanding it. She hopes to have educated family members who can help her run her business in the future.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her child and to purchase more cooking oil, sugar and salt.

loans.name: Dukore/kigeyo Group

texts.fr:
Innocent( le deuxieme à gauche dans le photos) est membre du groupe DUKORE/ KGY. Il est marié et a 50 ans. il a 6 enfants, le plus agé a 25 ans et le moins agé a 10 ans. parmi ses enfants 4 vont à l`école.son niveau d`éducation est de 6 eme primaire. il sollicite cet emprunt pour louer les champs à cultiver, acheter les fumier et les engrains chimiques , acheter les semences ainsi que payer le main d`oeuvre. les difficultes attendus de non remboursement sont les suivant:
-mauvaise condition climatique, et Epidémie Agricole

les stratégies pour la croissance de son affaire sont d`être ponctuel avec la saison et d`utiliser les engrain chimique et les fumiers pour avoir une bonne récolte.

ses ambitions sont de moderniser ses agriculure et de respecter les récommandation des Agronomes
les ambitions pour sa famille sont de scolariser ses enfants et d`assurer le bien être de sa famille.
texts.en:
Innoncent (second from the left in the picture) is a member of DUKORE / KGY Group. He's 50 years old, married, and has 6 children. The eldest is 25 years old, the youngest is 10. Out of them, four attend school.

Innoncent has a 6th grade education. He's seeking this loan in order to rent fields to cultivate, buy manure and chemical fertilizers, buy seeds, and pay for labor. The difficulties foreseen in repaying the loan are poor climatic conditions and crop epidemics. 

His strategies to grow his business are to be timely with the season and to use chemical fertilizers and manure to obtain a good harvest.

He ambitions to modernize his farming practices and respect the recommendations provided by agronomists. Regarding his family, his ambitions are to send his children to school and ensure the well-being of his family.

loans.use: rent fields to cultivate

loans.name: Dutezimbere Ubuhinzi No. 4 Group

texts.fr:
FAUSTIN est membre du groupe DUTEZIMBERE UBUHINZI No. 4 , il est âgé de 36 ans et a 2 enfants. le plus âgé a 10 ans et le moins âgé a 6 ans. ce deux enfants vont à l`école.il sollicite ce crédit pour acheter les angrais chimiques et payer le main d`oeuvre.il n`attend aucun difficulte pour rembourser.

ses stratégie pour la croissance de son activité est de demander d`autre credit pour accroitre son business.
ses ambition dans le business est d`être le producteur des farines de maïs et pour sa famille,c`est eduquer ses enfants.
texts.en: Faustin is a member of the Dutezimbere Ubuhinzi No. 4 group. He is 36 years old and has 2 children, the eldest of whom is 10 years old and the youngest, 6. Both of his children go to school. He is requesting this loan in order to buy chemical fertilizer and to pay the labourers. He expects to have no difficulty in repaying the loan. His strategy for growth is to request more loans so that he can increase his business. His business ambition is to become the main producer of corn flour and, as for his family, he would like to ensure that his children get an education.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizer and to pay the labourers.

loans.name: Seif

texts.en:
Seif is happy about the support he has received through Milango. His poultry business is doing well. In addition to that business, he has been running a transport business and a carpentry shop. He wants to focus on these two businesses over the next few months.
Seif is, therefore, applying for a loan of 93,850 Kenyan shillings to purchase timber and other carpentry materials.

loans.use: To purchase timber and other carpentry materials.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a 31-year-old wife and mother of two school-age children who lives with her family in Kisauni, Kenya. She stays in a rental house with solar power and tap water. Her major monthly expenditure is the payment of school fees. She owns a food kiosk, which is an important source of income for her and her family. 

Jane is seeking a loan amounting to 10,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to buy soft drinks and cakes for her kiosk. She is very grateful for this help.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks and cakes for resale.

loans.name: Iamze

texts.en:
Iamze is 47 years old. She is married and lives in Kareli District with her husband, Grigol, and two children, who go to school. Iamze requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan requests were rejected all the time because of her low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of the income for the family is from agricultural activities. In particular, they have a hectare of agricultural land, where haricot nut trees and cherry trees are grown. Besides thhis, her husband works as an artisan and gets a monthly income. It is hardly enough for food for the family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Iamze requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. Her loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high-risk borrowers” because of low income. 

With the received credit, Iamze will purchase a milk cow. After purchasing a milk cow, she plans to produce dairy products and increase the income of the family. A small part of the loan will be used to cultivate the land for sowing seeds. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow and cultivate the agricultural land.

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en:
Bernard is a young and hardworking family man aged 25 years old, married to Wanjiru who is a housewife. He is a father of a one-year-old child. He learnt about KADET LTD through a credit officer who is s regular customer in his fruit store. He operates a fruit stall where he specializes in bulk selling of bananas to small scale traders.


He has acquired a first loan of KES. 30,000 which will facilitate him in purchasing a variety of fruits for sale. He hopes to use anticipated proceeds to enlarge his  busy stall.

His hopes and dreams are to raise his family's living standard as well as grow his business to a large scale outlet.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of fruits for resale

loans.name: Arsen

texts.en:
Arsen is involved in agriculture. He keeps 2 cows, 6 calves and 10 chickens. Arsen gets milk, which he uses in cheese production. Then he sells the cheese and other milk products in the local markets and gets income. This income is hardly enough for covering family's basic expenses, so it is very difficult for Arsen to save money for the expansion of his farm. 

Arsen has applied for this loan to purchase three bulls and forage for feeding them. This will enable him to expand his agricultural activities and gather higher income.

Arsen hopes that with the help of this loan he will be able to sustain his family and ensure a better future for his family. Arsen is from Urut village and lives with his wife and 28-year-old son.

loans.use: to pay for three bulls and forage for feeding them

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase broiler hens, feed and drugs.

loans.name: Basam

texts.en: Basam is a 26-year-old married man, has three children, and lives in Sana`a, Yemen. He has a taxi. He saved a small amount of money and borrowed additional money from his relatives to buy the taxi. He works hard to provide his family expenses. He has been offering taxi transportation services to his clients. He applied for a youth loan of 150,000 YER from AMB to buy spare parts for his taxi.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his taxi.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El comité Mujeres Unidas nace con la idea de crecimiento que todas las miembros tienen, ya que quieren ayudar a sus familias por medio de ese trabajo en conjunto que todas hacen.
La Sra.  Elisa es una de las miembros, quien es una persona muy trabajadora y que lucha por su familia, para poder darles todo lo que necesitan. Ella es modista y también tiene una despensa con todo lo que sus clientes necesitan para la casa. Gracias a sus trabajos y al apoyo de su familia y su grupo esta saliendo adelante.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de telas, hilos, y también insumos para su despensa, para que de esa forma pueda seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo y así ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
The communal bank “Mujeres Unidas” (United Women) was born with the idea of growth that all of the members have, as they want to help their families by means of the work as a whole that they all do.

Elisa is one of the members who is a very hardworking person and who fights for her family to be able to give them everything they need.  She is a dressmaker and also she has a small grocery store with everything that her customers need for the home.  Thanks to her work and to the support of her family and her group she is getting ahead.

She is requesting this loan to be able to invest it in the purchase of cloth, thread and also supplies for her small grocery store, so that in this manner she can continue with her work as she has been doing it and thus help her family.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread and supplies for her small grocery store.

loans.name: Maria Lisy

texts.es:
Maria es una vendedora excelente, le esta yendo muy bien en su negocio, ya que sus ventas cada vez estan en mas ascenso. Gracias al crédito anterior con Kiva pudo comprar mas joyas y cumplir con los pedidos que sus clientes le habían hecho y también tener mejor variedad para ofrecerles. este muy agradecida por la ayuda que recibió, pues le fue de mucha ayuda.
Solicita nuevamente del crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de más joyas, para poder seguir creciendo como vendedora, y poder seguir ayudando a su familia como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por la nueva oportunidad que esta recibiendo, ya que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
María is an excellent saleswoman. Her business is thriving, since sales are continuously increasing. Thanks to her previous loan with Kiva, she could buy more jewelry and deliver all the orders her customers had made. She could also offer more variety. María appreciates the help she received, since it was very useful for her.

She is requesting a loan again, to invest in buying more jewelry in order to continue to grow as a saleswoman and continue helping her family as she has done so far. She appreciates this new opportunity, which will be of great help for her.

loans.use: to buy jewelry to sell.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a 45-year-old wife and mother of four children from Lambwe, Kenya. Her children are aged 18, 16, 14 and eight years old respectively.

Jane has been operating a small green grocer's stall along Homabay highway for the last 15 years, with a monthly income of 10,000 Kenyan shillings (KES). She is now taking her second loan with KADET LTD, which she will use to purchase more vegetables to sell. She will use the anticipated profit to support her parents and her family.

She has a dream of expanding her business into a large one.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy electronics spare parts and items like TVs. for sale.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon  is 27 years old, married, and has three children, one of whom attends school.  He lives in the town of Koboko  in Uganda. For the past eight years, Simon  has been working hard to manage his retail store, which sells sugar, flour, rice, and other items. 

To expand his business, Simon is requesting a loan from BRAC Uganda for 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings, which he will use to stock more goods such as cooking oil and sweets. This loan will help Simon  to generate greater profits and expand his business to the wholesale level. Simon  hopes that in the future he will be able to open a big shop. 

Simon is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Simon  who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.


"

loans.use: to purchase cooking oil and sweets to sell.

loans.name: Ruben

texts.en:
Ruben is involved in cattle breeding. He keeps livestock, which currently includes 12 cows and 120 sheep. 

Ruben works hard to sustain his family, which consists of his wife and son. As cattle breeding is the only source of income for Ruben, it is very difficult for him to cover his family's basic costs and save money for feeding the livestock. So, he has applied for this loan to purchase forage for feeding the livestock. This will enable him to continue his work and he will be able to sustain his family. 

Ruben waits for your financial support and hopes that this loan will give him an opportunity to keep his livestock.

loans.use: to pay for forage for feeding the livestock.

loans.name: Cristian Noe

texts.es: Cristian, tiene 24 años de edad, es casado, tiene un hijo y vive en el municipio del Negrito Yoro con su familia. Hace dos años que Cristian, se ha dedicado al cultivo de sandia  y le ha dado buenos resultados. La producción la vende en el mercado local. Esta solicitando un tercer préstamo a ODEF, el cual es por 15,000 lempiras y los va invertir en la compra de insumos como abonos para mejorar el cultivo y para pago de mano de obra. Su objetivo es incrementar la producción para sacar adelante a su familia y darles mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Cristian is 24 years old, married, and has one child. He and his family live in the town of Negrito Yoro.

For the past two years, Cristian has been growing watermelons and has achieved good results. Whatever he produces is sold at the local market. He is requesting his third loan from ODEF in the amount of 15,000 HNL. The proceeds will be invested in supplies, such as compost, so that he can improve his crop. He will also pay for labor.

Cristian’s goal is to increase his production so that his family can move forward and achieve a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies for his watermelon crop and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Aba sells the traditional corn and cassava dough, banku, in Ayensudu, near Elmina. Aba has received no formal education. She is a widow and has five children. Aba has been selling her banku recipe for many years now. She is responsible for paying to support herself and her children and save for their future. 

Her loan will be used to buy more corn and cassava to prepare her banku recipe. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to expand her banku-making enterprise and save for her future.

loans.use: to buy more corn and cassava to prepare her banku recipe for sale.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a 34-year-old, married woman. She has four children, all of whom are in school. She lives in a rental house with solar power and tap water. 

She owns a clothes business where she sells second-hand clothes. She has approached Yehu Microfinance Trust with a loan amounting to KES 20,000 to buy bundles of clothes. She is grateful for the opportunity and hopes this will boost her business.

loans.use: to buy bundles of clothes for her business.

loans.name: Fusena

texts.en:
Fusena sells pineapples and watermelons in and around Ayensudu, near Elmina. Fusena has received no formal education. She is married and has four children. Her husband is a mechanic in the area. 

Fusena has been selling pineapples and watermelons for some time now. She is responsible for helping her husband take care of their family’s expenses. Her loan will be used to buy an increased quantity of fruit to sell in the market. 

She hopes to use the new profits from her business to grow her fruit-selling trade and possibly expand into selling an increased variety of local fruits to meet customers' seasonal demands.

loans.use: to buy an increased quantity of fruit to sell in the market.

loans.name: Anabel

texts.es: Anabel de 26 años de edad vive junto a su feliz familia su esposo y sus hijos. Es una mujer con diversas cualidades entre ellas servicial, honesta, humilde y muy trabajadora, se caracteriza porque en su hogar no falte el pan de cada día, siempre lo ha hecho así y hoy más que nunca no se rinde por sus hijos que son un mayor ilusión en la vida y lo que la impulsan a seguir adelante. Anabel es agricultora de los principales granos básicos de nuestro país, maíz y frijol es lo que ha hecho toda su vida, desea tener los recursos necesarios para esta próxima cosecha que se acerca es por eso que se visitó INTEGRAL para solicitar un crédito y comprar insumos agrícolas como: abonos, fertilizantes, pesticidas, u otros. Espera contar con la ayuda solicitada así podrá tener una abundante cosecha y seguirá dándole una buena calidad de vida a élla y su familia.
texts.en:
Anabel, age 26, lives with her happy family, her husband, and her children.  She is a woman with diverse virtues among which are being helpful, honest, humble, and very hard-working.  She is known for always bringing home the daily bread.  She has always done so and now, more than ever, she does not give up because of her children.  They are a great joy in life, and they drive her to get ahead.

Anabel is a farmer, and she grows grains that are basic to the country, corn and beans.  She has done this all of her life.

She wishes to have the needed resources for the coming harvest, which is getting closer.  That is why she visited Integral in order to request a loan.  She will use the loan to buy agricultural supplies like manure, fertilizer, pesticides, and others.  She hopes to have the requested help.  This way she will be able to have an abundant harvest, and she will continue giving herself and her family a good quality of live.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies like manure, fertilizer, pesticides, and others.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 47 years old, married and blessed with six children between 28 and 11 years old. She owns a retail shop selling industrial goods and has been in the business for 12 years, earning an income of KES. 8,000.

She is now requesting her first loan of KES. 35,000 with KADET LTD and intends to use this amount to pay school fees for her school-going children and also add more stock of tea leaves, and washing detergents to sell.
The anticipated profits from the business will be used to pay the loan. Her dream is to venture into a new business.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children and add tea leaves and washing detergents to retail shop stock.

loans.name: Perpetuo Socorro Group

texts.es:
Perpetuo Socorro,  se denomina el excelente grupo de mujeres conformado en la ciudad de Itá, gracias a que su actual directora Maria contacto con la asesora y decidieron formar un grupo, hoy se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto  en el 4° ciclo, en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa.
Maria se dedica  a la  venta de comida en su copetín, ella comenta que tiene muy buena venta, ya que sus comidas son muy ricas y apreciadas por sus clientes y así es que está saliendo adelante y ayudando a su familia. Su meta es poder seguir trabajando y el día de mañana tener un gran restaurante o salón donde poder ofrecer mayor comodidad a sus clientes.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de insumos para sus alimentos, como ser carnes, verduras, condimentos, y demás para poder seguir dando una buena comida a sus clientes.
texts.en:
“Perpetuo Socorro” is the name of an outstanding group of women that was formed in the city of Itá, thanks to its current director, Maria. She contacted an advisor and then decided to form a group. The group is now working on its fourth loan cycle of the program in a cooperative and unified manner.

Maria sells food at her snack bar. She says that she generates very good sales since her foods are very rich and well-appreciated by her customers. As a result, she is able to move forward and help her family. Her goal is to continue working until one day she is able to have a large restaurant or a banquet hall where her customers will be more comfortable.

Maria is requesting a loan so that she can buy supplies for her snacks such as meat, vegetables, condiments, and other items. This will enable her to provide good food to her customers.

loans.use: to buy meat, vegetables, condiments, and other supplies.

loans.name: Abubakarr's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above are teachers from one of the primary schools in Koidu, in eastern Sierra Leone. This group of teachers has come to Kiva field partner SMT, to request a loan of 17,700,000 Sierra Leonean Leones for the entire group. With the help of this loan, this group of able and dedicated teachers will be able to meet their immediate financial challenges and at the end of each month, can easily make the loan payment using their monthly salaries. It is their school’s bursar who is directly responsible for recording the deductions and making the repayment on their behalf.
Abubakarr is the featured leader of this group. The 44-year-old is a native of Kabala, in northern Sierra Leone. He is married to a trader and the two have 4 children – 2 in primary school, 1 in secondary and 1 that is still too young for school. Abubakarr has been a teacher for 22 years now. He has requested this loan in order to buy building materials like iron, corrugated zincs, sand, nails, cements, etc. for the construction of a house to live in.

loans.use: to buy building materials like iron, corrugated zincs, sand, nails, cements, etc. for the construction of a house to live in.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace sells cooked rice in Ayensudu, near Elmina. Grace received a middle school education. She is married and has 3 children. Her husband is a mason. Grace has been selling cooked rice for some time now. She is responsible in helping her husband pay their children's school fees and taking care of other general family expenses. Her loan will be used to buy an increased quantity of rice and other ingredients necessary to cook and sell rice in the market. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to develop her food preparation business further.

loans.use: to buy an increased quantity of rice and other ingredients necessary to cook and sell her rice in the market.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for cultivation and buy seeds for planting.

loans.name: Swali

texts.en:
Swali is 48 years old and lives in Koboko, Uganda. He is married and has 6 children,  4 of which are currently in school. For the past 30 years, Swali has been working hard to manage his livestock. 

To help expand his business, Swali has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy animal feed, and that will help Swali to generate greater profits and improve his family’s standard of living. Swali hopes that in the future he will be able to start a butcher shop.

Swali is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Swali who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy animal feed.

loans.name: Jose Javier

texts.es: Jose, tiene 36 años de edad, soltero, tiene un hijos y reside en una aldea del municipio de la Masica, Atlántida junto a su madre. El tiene 15 años de administrar una cafetería en uno de los institutos del municipio, cuenta con la ayuda de una empleada quien elabora varia comida como ser pastelitos de carne, baleadas, tajadas con carne, refrescos, jugos, galletas, churros, etc. Sus clientes son los alumnos del colegio. Esta solicitando un segundo préstamo es que de 25,000 lempiras con el cual va surtir de refrescos y jugos para su negocio. El espera que su negocio crezca y obtener más ganancias para cubrir con los gastos familiares.
texts.en:
Jose is 36 years old, single, and has one child. He lives with his mother in a neighborhood in the town of Masica, Atlántida.

For the past 15 years, Jose has managed a cafeteria at one of the schools in town. He has the help of one employee who prepares various foods such as meat turnovers, baleadas (the Honduran version of a burrito), and fried plantains with meat. Jose also offers soft drinks, juices, cookies, donuts, and other items. His customers are students of the school.

He is requesting his second loan in the amount of 25,000 HNL. The proceeds will be used to restock his business with soft drinks and juices. Jose hopes to grow his business so that he can generate more earnings to cover his family’s expenses.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks and juices.

loans.name: Bahodir

texts.ru:
Баходир трудолюбивый,ответственный и пунктуальный мужчина в возрасте 35 лет.  Он женат имеет 3 детей. Бахадыр занимается куплей продажей скота. Этим видом деятельности начал заниматься   10 лет назад.  Он очень ценит свою работу так как этим зарабатывает на хлеб.  В начале своей деятельности Бахадир  имел только двух  баранов, откормив продал за хорошую цену и был очень рад. Таким образом он   увеличивал  свой товарооборот. Бахадыр уже знает все преимущества этого дела.  
 За счет увеличения  дохода  Баходир смог  также купить  магазин в центре села. Там его жена торгует    продуктами  питания. Это их дополнительный доход.  Но основной доход у них от откорма скота. Поэтому Бахадыр обратился в организацию Арванд за кредитом, чтобы приобрести скот и развивать свой бизнес по животноводству.
 Он очень рад,что существуют такие организации как Арванд с помощью которых люди нуждающиеся в финансовой поддержке могут осуществить свои планы.
texts.en:
Bahodir is a hard-working, responsible and punctual 35-year old man. He is married and has three children. Bahodir busy and resells cattle. He has started this business 10 years ago. He values his work as it allows him to support himself. At the beginning, Bahodir had only two sheep; after fattening the animals, he sold them at a good price and was very glad to do so. In this way, he kept increasing his sales volume. At present Bahodir already knows how to manage the business to his advantage. 

After increasing his revenues, Bahodir has been able to buy a store in the middle of his village. His wife sells food products in this store. This is an additional source of income for them. But their main income is from raising livestock. This is why Bahodri has applied to Arvand for a loan in order to buy more livestock and develop his animal-raising business. He appreciates the existence of organizations such as Arvand, which allow people in need of financial support to fulfill their plans.

loans.use: to  purchase  livestock.

loans.name: Araba

texts.en: Araba is married and has 2 children. She has received no formal education. Araba sells the traditional Ghanaian corn dough, kenkey, in Ayensudu near Elmina, and has done so for some time now. Her husband is a farmer. Araba uses her income to support her husband in paying their family's general living expenses. Araba will use the loan to purchase more corn to prepare her kenkey recipe. With the new profits from her expanded business, Araba plans to increase her capital base and secure her business now and in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more corn to prepare kenkey.

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.es: Maria Cristina de 44 años de edad ella es originaria de San Martin Jilotepeque, ella se dedica a la crianza de pollos desde hace 6 años y gracias a Dios le a ido bien, es por eso que esta solicitando este credito para la compra de mas pollos pequeños para la crianza ya que el anelo de ella es tener muchos pollos para agrandar mas su granja, espera que le puedan ayudar con el credito que solicita.
texts.en:
Maria Cristina is 44 years old and originally from San Martin Jilotepeque. She has been raising chickens for six years and is doing well thanks to God.

For this reason, she is requesting a loan so that she can buy more young chickens to raise. Her wish is to have more chickens so that she can expand her farm. Maria hopes that the loan she requested will be of help.

loans.use: to buy chickens to raise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase goats.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is a 33-year-old, hardworking lady. She is married with two children both of whom are in school. Veronica lives in Kisauni, in her own house with clean tap water. Her major monthly expenditure is the payment of school fees.
She runs a water selling business and has been running it for two years now. She has requested a loan of KES 15,000 to buy a water tank. This will enable her to satisfy her customer’s needs. She is grateful for the opportunity.

loans.use: to buy a water tank.

loans.name: Flavia

texts.en:
Flavia is 34 years old and lives in Koboko, Uganda. She is married and has 2 children who are all currently in school. For the past 13 years, Flavia has been working hard to manage her décor business, which rents party decorations and flowers.

To help expand her business, Flavia has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to add capital and buy more decoration items for parties. This will help Flavia to generate greater profits and meet customer needs. Flavia hopes that in the future she will be able to look after her children.

Flavia is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Flavia who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to add capital and buy more decoration items for parties.

loans.name: Tatu

texts.en: Tatu is grateful for her previous loan which enabled her business to grow tremendously. She is requesting a new loan of ksh.30000 to restock her retail shop and buy sacks of sugar, packs of tea leaves and detergents.

loans.use: to restock her retail shop and buy sacks of sugar, packs of tea leaves, and detergents.

loans.name: Immaculate

texts.en: Immaculate is a 40-year-old hardworking woman with 3 children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She sells clothes and also has rental houses where she earns extra income. The ever changing customer preferences and price fluctuation affect her business growth while her desire is to own a modern boutique. She is a good mother and desires to educate all her children up to the University level; one of them is already there. Immaculate intends to use the loan to buy clothes and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy clothes and pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Odette

texts.en: Odette is 27 years old. She is married to a businessman and they have two children who are 1 and 3 years old. With the loan, she wants to buy more goats and cows to sell. The profits from the business will be used to provide food for the family.

loans.use: to buy more cows and goats to sell.

loans.name: Jean Pierre

texts.en: Jean Pierre is 32 years old. He sells different beers in his bar. With the loan, he wants to add more beers for sale. The profits from the business will be used to make savings.

loans.use: to buy more beers for sale.

loans.name: Andranik

texts.en:
Andranik, a 33-year-old farmer from Margahovit village in Lori region, lives with his parents, wife and two sons. Andranik runs a farm which currently includes 6 cows, 10 chickens and 10 colonies of bees. As the only breadwinner of the family, he works hard to sustain his big family.

Because it is very difficult for Andranik to save money and expand his livestock, he is requesting this loan to purchase a cow and five pigs. This will lead to a higher income which will improve his family's living conditions. Andranik dreams of having a big farm, and this loan is one more step on the road to achieving that dream.

loans.use: to pay for a cow and five pigs.

loans.name: Ameeda

texts.en:
Ameeda sells ice cream and cold, pure water in Ayensudu, near Elmina. Ameeda has received no formal education. She is married and has five children. Her husband is a blacksmith in their community. 

Ameeda has been selling ice cream and water for some time now. She is responsible for supporting her husband with their family's general living expenses. 

Her loan will be used to buy an increased quantity of local ice cream and pure water to sell in the market. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to grow her ice cream and water-selling trade and save for the future.

loans.use: to buy an increased quantity of local ice cream and pure water to sell in the market.

loans.name: Cristino

texts.es:
El señor Cristino tiene 68 años, es casado, vive con su esposa en la compañía Caballero Punta de Ybycuí, tiene   4 hijos todos mayores de edad y casados, que ya son independientes.
Cristino cuenta que hace aproximadamente 40 años se dedica a la actividad de las ventas, ya que tiene una despensa y también vende leche, para comenzar con su negocio nos cuenta que recibió ayuda de su papá quien le regaló el terreno donde construyó su casa, además de que le dio vacas lecheras para poder sustentarse, y gracias al esfuerzo y el trabajo arduo pudo ahorrar y montar su despensa junto con su esposa. Día a día fue surtiendo su negocio y gracias a la buena atención  pudo formar su clientela. El es una persona muy trabajadora y resultado de eso es que sus hijos son personas de bien.
El préstamo solicitado será destinado para la compra de productos varios para surtir mejor su despensa, como ser verduras, carnes, panificados, frutas, fideos, y demás. Agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya y kiva por la oportunidad que recibe, espera poder satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes ofreciéndoles mayor variedad de productos.
texts.en:
Sr. Cristino is 68 years old and married. He lives with his wife in Caballero Punta de Ybycuí. They have four grown children who are married and independent.

Cristino has been in the retail business for approximately 40 years. He manages a food pantry, but he also sells milk. When he started his business, Cristino says that he received help from his father who gave him land on which to build his house as well as two dairy cows by which he could support himself. Thanks to his effort and hard work, Cristino was able to save some money and open a food pantry with his wife. Each day he keeps his business stocked and thanks to his good service, he was able to establish a customer base. Cristino is a hardworking person, and as a result, his children have turned out to become good people.

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy various products to restock his food pantry such as vegetables, meat, baked goods, fruits, noodles, and other items. He is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva for the opportunity he has received. Cristino hopes to satisfy the needs of his customers by offering them a wider variety of products.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, baked goods, fruits, noodles, and other products.

loans.name: Marcos Antonio

texts.es: Marcos de 59 años de edad habita en casa de su propiedad junto con su esposa e hijo. Él se dedica  a la agricultura de los principales granos básicos como son: maíz y frijol. Después de sacar la cosecha  comercializa una parte de su cultivo para poder suplir las necesidades de su hogar que cada día son mayores. Él es muy  trabajador, emprendedor cuya principal motivación es darle el sustento y una buena calidad de vida a su familia con el fruto de su trabajo. Ha trabajado toda su vida en la agricultura y es así como ha logrado formar su hogar, ya que esta es su principal fuente de ingresos tomo la decisión de acercarse a una agencia de INTEGRAL para solicitar un crédito ya que la fecha para empezar las siembras se aproximan y quiere asegurar el terreno para su próxima siembra. Este préstamo le servirá  para invertir en la comprar de los insumos agrícolas como: semillas, insecticidas, abonos, etc.  Para comenzar la siembra lo más antes posible y poder cosechar los frutos de su esfuerzo. Confía plenamente que obtendrá una cosecha abundante la cual la cual le permitirá mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Marcos is 59 years old. He lives in a house on his property with his wife and child. He makes a living through the agriculture of the main staple grains, corn and beans. After the harvest, he sells a part of his crops to be able to supply the necessities of his home that each day are becoming greater. 

He is very hard-working and enterprising, and his primary motivation is to provide sustenance and a good quality of life to his family with the fruit of his labors. He has worked all of his life in agriculture, which is how he has succeeded in forming his home since this is his main source of income. 

He made the decision to approach an agency of INTEGRAL to request a loan since the date to begin the sowing is approaching and he wants to secure the land for his next sowing. This loan will be used to invest in the purchase of agricultural supplies such as seeds, insecticides, fertilizers, etc. to begin the sowing as early as possible and to be able to harvest the fruits of his labor.

 He fully believes that he will obtain an abundant harvest which will permit him to improve his and his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of agricultural supplies such as: seeds, insecticides, fertilizers, etc.

loans.name: Evaste

texts.en: Evaste is 43 years old. She is married with two children. She sells cows and goats. With the loan, she wants to buy more cows and goats to sell. She is planning to build a house with the profits.

loans.use: to buy more cows and goats to raise and sell.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is single and has 4 children. She has received no formal education. Mary owns and operates a bakery in Ayensudu, which she has done for some time now. Mary uses her income to support herself and her children and save for their future. Mary will use the loan to purchase an increased quantity of ingredients and supplies necessary to operate her bakery and meet her customer’s demands. With the new profits from her expanded business, Mary plans to develop her bakery shop further and save for the future.

loans.use: to purchase an increased quantity of ingredients and supplies necessary to operate her bakery.

loans.name: Constantine

texts.en: Constantine is 29 years old. She has sold sugar and rice for the past four years. With the loan, she wants to buy more sugar and rice to sell. The profits from the business will be saved.

loans.use: to buy more sugar and rice to sell.

loans.name: Asibe

texts.en:
Asibe is single and has four children. She has received schooling through middle school level. 

Asibe sells cooked rice in Ayensudu, near Elmina. She has been selling her cooked rice recipe for some time now. Asibe uses her income to support herself and her children and to save for their future. 

Asibe will use the loan to purchase an increased quantity of rice and other ingredients necessary to prepare her rice for sale in the market. With the new profits from her expanded business, Asibe plans to increase her capital base and secure her business, now and in the future.

loans.use: to purchase an increased quantity of rice and other ingredients necessary to prepare her rice for sale in the market.

loans.name: Katsaka

texts.en: Katsaka is grateful for her previous loan. It helped her improve her business. She has now requested a loan of KES 50,000 to buy sacks of charcoal.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Hector Alfonso

texts.es: Hector de 38 años de edad vive con su esposa de 22 años de edad y su pequeño. Es un hombre muy trabajador ya que siempre se ha caracterizado por dar y brindar lo mejor para su familia, es honesto, sincero que su mayor sueño y anhelo es que sus hijos siempre viva en condiciones dignas y que en su hogar nunca haga falta el pan de cada día. Actualmente se dedica a la labor de ser jornalero es decir tiene una pequeña cosecha, siembra los principales granos básicos como frijol  y maíz vende cierta parte y lo otro lo deja para su familia, es así como Hector se gana la vida honradamente. El siente la necesidad de mejorar un poco sus cosechas es por esa razón que solicita a INTEGRAL un préstamo para poder así comprar insumos básicos como: Fertilizantes, Pesticidas, Insecticidas, semillas, Abonos entre otros. Él sabe que con eso mejoraran sus ventas y podrá seguirle brindando un buen bienestar a su familia como lo ha hecho hasta el día de hoy
texts.en:
Hector, 38 years old, lives with his 22-year-old wife and his small child. He is a very hard-working man since he has always been known for giving and providing the best to his family. He is honest and sincere. His greatest dream and desire is that his children always live in dignified conditions, and that in his home there is never an absence of daily bread.

Currently, he works as a day laborer, that is he has a small harvest. He sows the main staple grains like beans and corn and sells one part, leaving the other for his family. This is how Hector makes a living honorably.

He feels the necessity of improving his harvests a little, and for this reason he is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL to be able to buy basic supplies like fertilizers, pesticides, insecticides, seeds, and compost, among others. He knows that with this his sales will improve and he will be able to continue providing comfort and well-being to his family as he has so far.

loans.use: to buy basic supplies like fertilizers, pesticides, insecticides, seeds, and compost, among others.

loans.name: Nahum Misraim

texts.es: Nahum de 51 años de edad, habita en casa de su propiedad junto con su esposa e hijos. Él se dedica al cultivo de los principales granos básicos desde hace muchos años,  la cual realiza año con año para llevar el pan de cada día a su hogar. Esta actividad son las que le permiten  cubrir las necesidades básicas de su hogar y Nahum las realiza con gran empeño y dedicación. Él es un hombre trabajador,  honrado y responsable vive en condiciones muy humildes junto a su familia y esta es la razón que le motiva a trabajar duramente para dar lo mejor a su familia ya que es la única forma  de poder cambiar la realidad en la que se encuentran. Nahum sabe que con un poco de ayuda para invertir en sus cultivos, podrá generar más ingresos los cuales le ayudaran a cambiar el futuro de su familia, es por estas razones que se acercó a INTEGRAL, para solicitar un crédito el cual solicita para invertir en la compra de insumos para sus cosechas como pesticidas, abono, semillas, etc. ya que es su  única fuente de ingresos y espera que estas cosechas sean mejores que los años anteriores para tener buenos ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Nahum is 51 years old and lives with his wife and children in a house he owns. He has farmed for many years, cultivating basic grains year after year in order to put bread on the table. His work as a farmer, which he performs with great dedication and resolve, has enabled him to cover the basic necessities of his household. He is a hardworking, honest and responsible man, who lives modestly with his family. The reason he works so hard is to provide the best for his family because this is the only way to change the realities they face.

Nahun knows that with a little help he will be able to invest in his crops and generate more income, which will help him change his family’s future. Consequently he approached Integral to request a loan so that he can purchase supplies for his crops, such as pesticides, compost, seeds, etc. Farming is his only source of income and he hopes that the coming harvest will be better than in previous years so that he can earn a good living for his family

loans.use: to purchase supplies for his crops, such as pesticides, compost, seeds, etc.

loans.name: David Antonio

texts.es: David de 30 años de edad reside junto a su esposa y sus hijos. Es un hombre visionario que lo que a él más le ha importado en la vida es dar lo mejor para sus hijos y que estos se lo agradezcan el día de mañana. Es muy trabajador se ha caracterizado por ser muy trabajador, ya que en la vida lo que mas desea en que sus hijos vean el esfuerzo que su padre hace dia a dia. Actualmente posee una pequeña cosecha donde cultiva:  maíz, maicillo, lororco. Buscando el bienestar de sus hijos David desea ampliar más su cosechas, mejorarlas y que siempre sean las preferidas por los clientes  es por eso que se acercó a INTEGRAL  para solicitar un crédito para la compra de insumos básicos como: fertilizantes, pesticidas, semillas, abonos u otros siempre buscando lo mejor para su familia espera contar con la ayuda necesaria y así seguir llevando el pan de cada día a su hogar
texts.en:
David is 30 years old and lives with his wife and children. David is always thinking about and planning for the future, because the most important thing in life for him is giving the best to his children and that his children be grateful for tomorrow. David is known for being hardworking, and what he wants most in life is for his children to see the effort and hard work their father puts in to each day.

David has a small field where he grows corn, sorghum and loroco [a vine with edible buds and flowers used for cooking]. Thinking of his children’s welfare, David wants to increase and improve his harvest so that customers always prefer his products to others. For this reason he approached INTEGRAL to request this loan to buy basic agricultural supplies such as fertilizers, pesticides, seeds, manure and others. David says that he is always looking for the best for his family and he hopes to receive the help necessary to continue bringing home bread to his family each day.

loans.use: to buy basic agricultural supplies such as fertilizers, pesticides, seeds, manure and others.

loans.name: Felix Antonio

texts.es: Felix de 52 años de edad y habita en casa de su propiedad junto con su compañera de vida y sus hijos. Él se dedica a la agricultura desde hace muchos años.Felix cultiva los principales granos básicos como: Maicillo  y maíz. Cada año repite esta actividad ya que es la única forma que conoce para ganarse la vida. Es una persona muy trabajadora, responsable y emprendedora. Vale la pena mencionar que vive en condiciones muy humildes junto con su familia, pero esta situación no lo desanima si no que le da fuerzas para continuar luchando por una calidad de vida diferente. Trabaja muy duro para llevar el pan de cada día a su hogar ya que no cuenta con otra fuente de ingresos  diferente a la agricultura. Es por esta razón que ha tomado la decisión de solicitar es préstamo a INTEGRAL para invertir en la compra del abono, fertilizantes, pesticidas y semillas. Con mucha confianza en Dios y en su trabajo espera tener una cosecha abundante de la cual pueda vender una parte y dejar otra parte para el consumo. Espera cumplir su sueño de dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida
texts.en: Félix, 52, lives in the house he owns with his life companion and their children.  He’s worked in agriculture for many years growing main grains like sorghum and corn.  He repeats this activity every year since it’s the only way he knows to earn a living.  He’s a very hardworking, responsible and enterprising man.  It’s worth mentioning that he lives under very humble conditions with his family but this situation does not discourage him but rather gives him the strength to continue striving toward a different quality of life.  He works very hard to earn his home’s daily bread since he has no other source of income besides agriculture.  Because of this, he’s decided to request an INTEGRAL loan to buy manure, fertilizer, pesticide and seeds.  With much trust in God and in his work, he hopes to obtain an abundant harvest to sell part of and to consume the other.  He hopes to reach his dream of providing better quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to buy manure, fertilizer, pesticide and seeds.

loans.name: Blanca Delmy

texts.es: Blanca 39 años de edad habita en casa de su propiedad junto con su esposo y sus hijos. Ella se dedica  a la agricultura de los principales granos básicos como son: maíz y frijol. Después de sacar la cosecha  comercializa una parte de su cultivo para poder suplir las necesidades de su hogar que cada día son mayores. Ella es una mujer muy emprendedora y admirable lo más importante en la vida es ganarse el pan de cada día dignamente con el trabajo de sus manos .Ha trabajado toda su vida en la agricultura y es así como ha logrado sobrevivir, puesto que no cuenta con otra fuente de ingresos diferente a la agricultura. Como toda mujer emprendedora y visionaria ha tomado la decisión de acercarse a esta institución ya que la fecha para empezar las siembras se aproximan y quiere estar preparada.  Es por esta razón que solicita este préstamo a INTEGRAL para invertir en la comprar de los insumos agrícolas como: semillas, insecticidas, abonos u  otros. Para comenzar la siembra lo más antes posible y poder cosechar los frutos de su esfuerzo. Confía plenamente que obtendrá una cosecha abundante la cual la cual le permitirá mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Blanca is 39 years old and lives with her husband and children in a house they own. She is a farmer who cultivates basic grains, such as corn and beans. After the harvest, she sells some of her crops in order to meet the increasing needs of her household. She is a very enterprising and admirable woman. It is most important to her to earn her daily bread in life by working decently with her own two hands.  

Blanca has worked all her life as a farmer and that is how she has survived since she can rely on no other source of income than agriculture. Like all visionary and enterprising women, she has decided to approach Integral because the date to begin sowing is approaching and she wants to be prepared. Thus she has requested this loan in order to purchase agricultural supplies, such as seeds, insecticides, fertilizer and other items. She wants to begin planting as soon as possible so that she can reap the fruit of her labor. She is confident that she will have an abundant harvest, which will enable her to improve her and her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies such as seeds, insecticides, fertilizer and other items.

loans.name: Dúo Bendicion De San Miguel Group

texts.es:
Dúo bendición de san Miguel
Este dúo está conformado por doña Cindy Johanna, ella tiene 26 años de edad, y tiene una hija de 6 año, doña Cindy se dedica al cultivo de arveja China  en sus terrenos propios que su papa le heredo, el anhelo de ella es tener un tanque de agua para regar su cultivo que en temporada de verano no le favorece bastante la tierra, por lo que su deseo  es ya no estar llevando agua para regar, y lo que ella desea es entregar su producción cada vez mejor eso lo ha logrado gracias a la capacitación que recibe en la cooperativa que esta situada en magdalena milpas altas, porque es socia de la cooperativa ya que lo que cultiva lo vende en la cooperativa y cada vez le exigen de mejor calidad,la actividad que realiza le ayuda para darle lo mejor a sus hija su anhelo es ver crecer y darle lo mejor que ella pueda,esta solicitando este credito para la compra de semillas y abono para su cultivo y tambien para la compra de material para la construccion de un tanque de agua.
texts.en:
St. Michael’s Blessing Duo

Cindy Johanna, 26, is a member of this duo.  She has a six-year-old daughter and she works growing Chinese peas on her own and she inherited from her father.  Her dream is to have a water tank to water her crops during the summer when the land most needs it because she doesn’t want to have to continue lugging water to water the crops and she wants to produce better crops each time; she’s been accomplishing this thanks to training she’s getting from the cooperative located in Magdalena Milpas Altas.  She’s a member of the cooperative because what she grows she sells to it and they insist on better quality every time.  The activity she does helps her provide the best for her daughter.  Her dream is to watch her develop and to give her the very best she possibly can.  She’s asking for this loan to buy seeds and manure for her crops and also to buy the building supplies to build a water tank.

loans.use: to buy seeds and manure and also to buy supplies to build a water tank.

loans.name: Mauricia Del Socorro

texts.es: Mauricia del Socorro es una mujer de sesenta y cinco años de edad, soltera, madre de seis hijos de 31, 32, 36, 37, 38, y 40 años de edad, todos independientes,. Es una mujer, trabajadora responsable, con ganas de superación personal, el cual desde muy joven ha tenido que trabajar para ganase el sustento de cada día. Ella es originaria del departamento de Chinandega el cual está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país, desde hace seis años se dedica a atender una pulpería, de la cual es propietaria, el  negocio primeramente lo inició como una tienda de ropa posteriormente fue incluyendo productos de consumos básico para el hogar, en el cual ofrece, granos básicos, productos de limpieza como jabones y detergentes, alimentos empacados, entre otros productos. Actualmente también cuenta con el apoyo económico de sus hijos. Mauricia solicita el crédito para fortalecer su capital de trabajo. Su meta es en un futuro poder terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en: Mauricia del Socorro is a sixty-five year old woman.  She is the mother of six children who are 31, 32, 36, 37, 38, and 40 years old.  They all live independently from her.  Mauricia is a hard-working, responsible woman who wants to improve her situation.  She has worked since she was very young to earn her daily bread.  She is a native of Chinandega Department, which is located in the west of the country.  For the last six years, Mauricia has made her living running a small grocery store, of which she is also the owner.  The business started out as a clothing store and later she started including basic household products like basic grains, cleaning products like soaps and detergents, packaged foods and other products.  She currently has the financial support of her children.  Mauricia is requesting the loan to strengthen her working capital.  Her goal is to, in the future, finish construction on her house.

loans.use: with the purchase of food products like rice, sugar, beans, cooking oil, soap, detergents, oatmeal, matches, dairy products and other items.

loans.name: Sanobar

texts.ru: Санобару 48 лет. Она является одной из повторных клиентов. Это ее 10 цикл займа. Все предыдущие ее займы имели потребительский характер, и она погасила все свои займы во время. На этот раз она обратилась в ИМОН в целях получения займа для организации собственного бизнеса. Санобар замужем. Ее муж, Бобо занимается услугой мастера по ремонту дома. Она имеет на воспитании 5 детей.  В целях улучшения условия проживания, Санобар хочет организовать свой бизнес, купле продажей индустриальных товаров. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 4000 сомони для покупки товара. Она нуждается и ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Sanobar is 48 years old. She is a repeat borrower, and this will be her 10th loan. Her previous loans were all for personal purposes and she paid them back on time. Now she has approached Imon with the aim of getting a loan to set up her own business. She is married and has 5 children at home. Her husband Bobo works in the field of home repair. In order to improve the family's standard of living, Sanobar wants to start her own business selling household goods. She is seeking a loan of 4,000 Somoni to buy inventory. She needs, and is waiting for, your kindness.

loans.use: To buy household goods to establish a new business

loans.name: Braikasu

texts.en:
Braikasu is married and has three children.  She sells the traditional rice dish, wakye, in Ayensudu near Elmina, which she has been doing for several years. Her husband is a security guard in their community. 

Braikasu is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy increased quantities of rice, beans, and red leaves to prepare her wakye recipe. She hopes to use the profits from her business to expand her wakye selling enterprise. She is responsible for helping to support her husband in paying the family's general expenses.

loans.use: to purchase rice, beans, and red leaves to prepare her wakye recipe.

loans.name: Francine

texts.en: Francine is 23 years old. She sells different items in her boutique. She wants the loan to add more new items, such as rice, sugar, and many more items to sell. She will use the profits to create savings.

loans.use: to buy more rice, sugar, and many more items to sell.

loans.name: Ikrom

texts.ru:
Икром житель Спитаменского района. Ему 43 года. Он женат. Икром живет вместе с женой и родителями. У него трое детей. Его сын работает в частной строительной бригаде. Мать Икрома пенсионерка, а двое других его детей учатся в средней школе. 
Икром работает в ООО Текстайл начальником охраны. Он намерен совмещать работу с бизнесом. Икром намерен открыть магазин стройматериалов. Он взял в аренду помещение, где проводит ремонт. Икром по началу планирует приобрести товары на небольшую сумму. Для того, чтобы начать свою деятельность ему необходима финансовая поддержка. 
Икром берет кредит для приобретения стройматериалов.
texts.en: Ikrom lives in the Spitamen region. He is 43 years old, married, and lives with his wife and parents. He has 3 children. His son works on a private construction crew. Ikrom's mother is retired, and his other two children study in high school. Ikrom works as the chief of security in a company called Textile. He intends to balance this job with his new business. He wants to open a store where he will sell construction materials. He has rented premises that he is fixing up. He plans to start out by spending a modest amount on inventory. In order to start his own business, he needs financial support. Ikrom is seeking a loan to purchase construction materials.

loans.use: to buy construction materials so he can open a store and start his own business

loans.name: Difasi

texts.en:
Difasi is 32 years old and lives in the town of Mbale in Uganda. He is married and has who children who are currently in school. For the past ten years, Difasi has been working hard to manage his retail store which sells sugar, flour, rice and others. 

To help expand his business, Difasi has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to increase his stock and buy sugar and cooking oil for the store. This will help Difasi generate greater profits and boost the business. He hopes that in the future he will be able to be self reliant. 

Difasi is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like him who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to increase his stock and buy sugar and cooking oil for his store

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba sells bread, the staple product in Ayensudu, near Elmina. Aba has received no formal education.  She is single and has three children. Aba has been selling bread for some time now. She is responsible for supporting herself and her children and saving for their future. Her loan will be used to buy flour, sugar, milk, butter and other necessary ingredients to prepare her breads. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to grow her bread-baking business.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, milk, butter and other necessary ingredients to prepare her breads.

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti is a resident of Likoni, Kenya. She is a businesswoman who runs a retail shop. In this shop, she sells clothes and coconuts. At times, she also sells from door to door. Mwanasiti was introduced to Milango by her friends and joined to access credit.

Mwanasiti is applying for a loan of 64,450 KES to buy coconuts and clothes for sale. She looks forward to a fruitful season ahead.

loans.use: To buy coconuts and clothes for sale.

loans.name: Ernestine

texts.en: Ernestine is 30 years old. She is married with two children. She sells shoes and her husband works as a home-builder. She wants the loan to buy more shoes for sale. With the profits she earns from the business, she plans to boost her savings.

loans.use: To buy more shoes for sale.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María tiene un Kiosco abierto donde vende dulces y bebidas pero además la ropa de mascota, para los perros, gatos y conejos. Vende vestidos de fiesta, vestidos del verano, chalecos y chamaras para el invierno y muchos mas. Lo que le gusta mas de su negocio es platicar con sus clientes. Hace doce años que tiene el negocio. En el principio solo vendía los comestibles, bebidas y botanas. Con el apoyo de Fondo Esperanza, pudo sacar créditos chiquitos y puso a vender la ropa de mascota, lo cual le permite ganar mejor sueldo y  apoyar a su familia. María es mama soltera con tres hijos mayores, uno que tiene 28 años y tiene discapacidad mental y vive con ella. Tener el negocio de ropa macota le ha ayudad cuidar a su hijo y comprarle sus medicinas.  María ocupara su préstamo para comprar una cortadora para utilizar en el negocio y para pagar una cuota para el auto usado que compro recientemente para transportar a ella y a su hijo discapacidad al trabajo. 
Mas adelante, Marie le gustaría crecer su negocio y vender solo la ropa de mascota para tener un sueldo mas fijo. Lo que mas le agrada de trabajar con Fondo Esperanza es la oportunidad de conocer gente, y aprender como manejar el negocio.
texts.en:
María has an open kiosk where she sells candy and soft-drinks but also pet clothes for cats, dogs and rabbits.  She sells party dresses, summer dresses, vests and winter jackets and much more.  What she likes best about her business is chatting with customers.  She’s had the business for 12 years now.  At first, she only sold foodstuffs, beverages and snacks.  With Fondo Esperanza’s support she was able to take out small loans and start selling pet clothes which has led to her earning higher income and to help her family.

María is a single mother of three adult children.  One of them is 28-years-old with a mental disability and lives with her.  Having her business selling pet clothes has helped her care for her son and to buy him his medicine.  

María will use the loan to buy a cutter she uses in her business and to make a car payment for the used car she bought recently to transport her and her disabled son to work.

Later on, María would like her business to grow in order to just sell pet clothes and earn a higher income.  What she likes best about working with Fondo Esperanza is the opportunity to meet people and learning how to manage her business.

loans.use: to buy a cutter and to make a car payment.

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
A married mother of two children, Linda sells fruit in Ayensudu, located near Elmina and the community in which her husband is a driver. She has been selling fruit for some time now, as she is responsible for helping her husband pay the family's accommodation bills and their children's school fees.

Linda will use her loan to buy an increased quantity and variety of fruit to sell in the market. She hopes to apply the new profits arising from the loan to develop her enterprise and possibly build a stall in the future.

loans.use: to buy an increased quantity and variety of fruit to sell in the market.

loans.name: Ruzanna

texts.en:
Ruzanna is from the Mrgashat village in the Armavir region. She lives with her husband and two children and is involved in agriculture. She owns agricultural land where she cultivates tomato, eggplant and cucumber.
She works hard to gather a good harvest and together with her husband sells it at the local markets.
As agriculture helps Ruzanna to have a stable income, she would like to expand her farm and start breeding cattle one day. Ruzanna has applied for this loan to purchase 3 pigs and forage for feeding them.
The loan is very important for Ruzanna to gather high income and sustain her family.
Ruzanna plans to expand her farm and she hopes that this loan will help her to accomplish her goals.

loans.use: to pay for 3 pigs and forage for feeding them.

loans.name: Claudia Del Rosario

texts.es: Claudia del Rosario es una mujer de cuarenta y cuatro años de edad soltera y madre de dos jóvenes de 21 y 23 años de edad, el menor de ellos estudiante de escuela secundaria. Claudia del Rosario es propietaria de un pequeño negocio donde vende refrescos naturales, también vende comidas rápidas como, tacos, enchiladas, entre otros productos. El negocio lo estableció desde hace cuatro años y lo inició en búsqueda de una forma de subsistir ya que no tenía empleo. Anteriormente  vendía solo refrescos, ahora ha incluido otros productos alimenticios. En la actualidad cuenta  también con el apoyo su hijo mayor. Con el crédito obtenido planea fortalecer su capital de trabajo y así ofrecer productos variados a sus clientes. Dentro de sus metas está terminar de construir su casa. Claudia esta sumamente agradecida con los inversionistas kiva por el apoyo que le brindan a la gente de escasos recursos y que tienen deseo de superación.
texts.en:
Claudia del Rosario, 44, is single and the mother of two young adults who are 21 and 23 years of age; the younger of the two attends secondary school.  Claudia del Rosario owns a small business selling natural beverages; she also sells fast-food like tacos and enchiladas, among others.  She started the business four years ago and started it seeking a way of supporting herself since she was unemployed.  She used to just sell beverages but now she’s included other food items.  She now gets support from her oldest son too.  

She plans to use the granted loan to strengthen her working capital thus offering a variety of products to her customers.  Among her goals is finishing building her house.  Claudia is most grateful to Kiva lenders for the support they provide to people of limited resources who want to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy ingredients, plastic bags, straws, etc.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en: Richard is a 42-year-old man with five children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is a farmer and for the period that he has been farming he has been able to pay school fees for his children and extend his farming activities. Price fluctuation and unpredictable weather changes affect the business but his desire is to venture into modern farming methods. Richard intends to use the loan to buy seedlings and manure for the farm.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and manure for the farm.

loans.name: Marie Chantal

texts.en: Marie Chantal is 31 years old. She is married with three children. She sells rice and sugar does this to provide food for her family. The requested a loan to buy more rice and sugar to sell. She will save the profits generated from the business.

loans.use: to buy more rice and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Godeleva

texts.en: Godeleva is married, with three children. She sells bananas and has been in the business for two years. With the loan, she wants to add more bananas to sell. The profits from the business will be used to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy more bananas to sell.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 27 years old. He is married to Irene who is a housewife and they are blessed with two children who are three and seven years old respectively.

Peter owns a small scale shop in his neighborhood. He has been doing this business for the last three years and makes a monthly income of KES. 90,000. He is applying for his third loan from KADET LTD which he will use to boost stock by purchasing more commodities e.g soft drinks, sugar, cooking fats and cooking oil for sale in his retail shop. He will use the anticipated profit to open another shop location.

His dream is to own a chain of wholesale shops thus being able to provide a secure future for his family.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, sugar, cooking fats and oils for his retail store.

loans.name: Simon Garcia

texts.es: Simon 45 años de edad habita junto  a su familia, su esposa y sus hijos .Por diversos comentarios entre sus vecinos lo caracterizan por ser un hombre muy emprendedor que siempre se ha caracterizado por ser el principal responsable de que en su hogar no falte el pan de cada día. Por sus cualidades sus vecinos lo admiran porque a pesar delas adversidades de la vida siempre se ha trabajado y ha sido responsable con sus hijos y su esposa. Simon se dedica a la labor de ser agricultor cultiva los principales granos básicos de la zona como son maíz y frijol, y así va sufragando las necesidades de su hogar.
