Hace 5 años cuando formó su familia y las responsabilidades crecieron, decidió abrir un taller de planchado y pintado de carros, según comenta gusta mucho de este oficio, pues sus padres alquilaban la casa a otros negociantes que tenían el mismo negocio, “mirando sus trabajos, aprendí y decidí realizar lo mismo”, afirma. Desde entonces le fue muy bien en este negocio, tiene clientes fijos y espera poder comprar las maquinarias para poder realizar un trabajo de nivel y así ganar más dinero, ya que no tiene mucha competencia. En esta oportunidad solictará 1000 soles para la compra de pintura ,oxígeno, lija y demás insumos para realizar su trabajo, a la vez se  compromete a ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas, ya que le enseñaron la responsabilidad y trabajo arduo.
texts.en:
24 year-old Abdias is a responsible man who lives with his wife, Gisela and his daughter Adriana in the house they inherited from his parents. 

5 years ago when he started his family and his responsibilities grew, he decided to open a car painting and planishing workshop. He says he likes this craft a lot. His parents rented the house to other businessmen who had the same business. "Looking at their work, I learned, and I decided to do the same," he says. 

Since then he has gone really well in this business; he's got fixed customers and hopes to be able to buy the machinery to carry out skilled work and therefore earn more money because he hasn't got much skill. 

He is applying for the opportunity to borrow 1000 soles to buy paint, oxygen, sandpaper and other supplies to do his work. At the same time he promises to be punctual with the payments of his installments because he has learnt to be hard-working and responsible.

loans.use: to buy paint and other reparation materials

loans.name: Reina Isabel

texts.es:
Reina, quiere continuar trabajando y mejorando el negocio, por eso tiene la iniciativa de continuar solicitando préstamo para realizar la compra de maíz, leña, verduras, entre otros que sean necesarios para mantener el negocio estable, incurrira en verduras frescas para ofrecer a los clientes.
El efecto que tuvo con el préstamo anterior, le ayudo a que su negocio contara con lo necesario para la venta, obtuvo una aceptación de los clientes, sus condiciones en la familia han mejorado a través del funcionamiento del negocio.
texts.en:
Reina wants to keep working and improving her business. For this reason, she is requesting another loan to buy corn, firewood, vegetables, and other necessary items to keep her business stable. She will also buy fresh vegetables to offer her customers. 

Reina's last loan helped her to keep her business well-stocked. Many customers are happy with it and her family's situation has improved as her business has become more successful.

loans.use: to buy corn, vegetables, and firewood.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.ru:
Александр женат. У него есть дети школьного и студенческого возраста. Александр имеет свой бизнес.
Александр занимается тепличным хозяйством. Его  опыт работы составляет 10 лет. Наиболее продаваемыми являются ранние и поздние огурцы, помидоры. Александр целеустремленный и ответственный. Он член поместной церкви.

Александр просит предоставить ему кредит в сумме 15000 гривен на покупку дров, удобрений и химикатов, а также на оплату труда наемным работникам на высадку рассады в теплицы.  Кредит поможет ему подготовиться к предстоящему сезону.
texts.en:
Alexander is married. He has children of school and student age. Alexander has his own business. Alexander works with greenhouse farming. He has 10 years of work experience. The bestselling products are early and late cucumbers and tomatoes. 

Alexander is a purposeful and responsible man. He is part of the local church. Alexander requests a loan in the amount of 15,000 hryvnia for the purchase of wood, fertilizers and chemicals, and further to pay for hired work for planting seedlings in the greenhouses. The loan helps him prepare for the upcoming season.

loans.use: to purchase wood, fertilizers and pay for workers

loans.name: Alphonsine

texts.fr:
Alphonsine a 47 ans, elle est divorcée, , elle a 5 enfants, le plus agé a 26 ans et le moins agé a 13 ans. 4 vont à l`école. ella le niveau d`étude de 6 eme sécondaire. elle sollicite cet emprunt pour acheter le cables électrique pour sa maison ,payer le main  d`oeuvre et acheter le cash power.

elle n`attend aucunes difficultés pour rembourser ce crédit.la stratégie pour accroitre son affaire est de construire une maison de qualité, son ambition est d`augmenter ses niveau des étude ,pour la famille c`est le bien être.
texts.en:
Alphonsine is 47 years old and divorced, and she has five children. The oldest is 26 years old, and the youngest is 13. Four of them go to school. She has a 6th grade education. She is requesting this loan to purchase electrical cables for her house, pay for labor, and purchase 'cash power'. 

She expects no difficulties at all in paying back this loan. Her strategy for growing her business is to build a quality house. Her ambition is to get more education, and for her family, it is to ensure its well-being.

loans.use: to purchase electrical cables

loans.name: Fati

texts.fr: Restauratrice de profession, Salissou est âgée de 35ans. Elle a pour conjoint un transitaire et ont 05 enfants dont 03 scolarisés. C’est pour contribuer aux dépenses du foyer qu’elle a démarré cette activité en 2012. Elle achète les matières premières dont elle a besoin (tomate, riz, huile végétale et autres) chez des grossistes au grand marché de Lomé et les transforme en nourriture pour servir ses nombreux. Afin d’augmenter sa quantité considérable de matières premières, elle fait un second crédit à WAGES  pour s’en approvisionner. Elle compte agrandir son activité et permettre à ses enfants de mieux s’épanouir.
texts.en: A professional cook, Salissou is 35 years old. Her husband is a freight agent and they have five children, of whom three are in school. In order to contribute to family expenditures, Salissou began her work in 2012. She buys the raw materials she needs (tomatoes, rice, vegetable oil, etc.)  from wholesalers in the Grand Market of Lomé and transforms them into cooked food to serve her numerous clientele. In order to add to her considerable quantity of raw ingredients, she is requesting a second loan from WAGES to use for stocking up. She intends to expand her activity and allow her children to flourish.

loans.use: to buy ingredients

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Please meet 50-year-old Alice.  She is married with four children, with the youngest being 14 years old.  Three of her children currently go to school.  

Alice owns a small eatery that also sells drinks and cell phone top-up cards in Torkpoi Town, Bo.  She works for 8 hours per day, 6 days per week at her business.  She wants to use the loan to purchase more food items, drinks and top-up cards to grow her business.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more food items, drinks and top-up cards for phones.

loans.name: Massah

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 47-year-old Massah. She is from Torkpoi Town in Bo, located in the south of the country. She is widowed with 8 children.

Massah owns a restaurant and also sells soap at her business. She works 9 hours a day, every day of the week, at her business. She started her business to educate her children and to engage herself. She says that sometimes business is difficult. She plans to use the loan to buy more soap and foodstuff. She hopes to use the loan to grow her business. 

Your support is greatly appreciated!

loans.use: to buy more soap and foodstuff

loans.name: Lautaro Jasinto

texts.es:
LAUTARO JASINTO tiene 44 años de edad de estado civil unión libre tiene dos hijos, vive con los hijos y con la espsa en Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar.

Es Integrante de la VRC ARRAYAPAMBA se encuentra formada por 12 socios que son de la misma comunidad, a 25 minutos de la Oicina de la Cooperativa, La actividad económica es la agricultura, crianza de animales y comercio.

LAUTARO JASINTO se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de fréjol, mora, además se dedica a la crianza, engorde y venta de cerdos y pollos.

Solicita el crédito para comprar insecticidas, líquido mata maleza, ranger, herbicidas, urea. Con la ayuda del crédito podra comprar semillas que le hace falta para la agricultura.

Las compras las realizará en la ciudad de Guaranda. El sueño es comprar terreno y aumentar la producción y dar el estudio a los hijos. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es la comptencia y la falta de capital para poder trabajar.
En el tiempo libre le gusta pasear y disfrutar de las fiestas de la comunidad.
texts.en:
Lautaro Jasinto is 44 years old. He is married in a civil union and has two children. Lautaro Jasinto lives with his wife and children in Chillanes in the Bolivar province. 

He is one of 12 members of VRC ARRAYAPAMBA, located 25 minutes away from the Oicina de la Cooperativa. There, most economic activity revolves around farming as well as raising and selling animals. Lautaro Jasinto makes a living growing beans and blackberries. He also raises and sells pigs and chickens.

Lautaro Jasinto is requesting this loan in order to buy insecticides, liquid weed killer, Ranger, herbicides, and urea. With the help of this loan, he will also be able to buy seeds that he needs for farming. These purchases will be made in Guaranda. 

Lautaro Jasinto's dream is to buy land and increase his production so that he can provide his children with an education. His biggest challenges are his competition and a lack of capital. 

In his free time, Lautaro Jasinto likes to visit and enjoy celebrations in his community.

loans.use: to buy insecticides, liquid weed killer, Ranger, herbicides and urea.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Please meet Josephine from Sierra Leone. She is 27 years old and is married with two children, ages 2 and 5.  Her oldest child currently attends school.

Josephine owns a business selling palm oil, wood, and rice from her home. She works diligently at her business for 10 hours a day, 6 days a week. She started her business initially to engage herself and to educate her children. She was a housewife before. 

Josephine wants to use the loan to purchase more palm oil, wood, and rice for her business. She wants to see the business get bigger and to educate her children. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil, wood, and rice

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en: Meet Fatmata from Torkpoi Town in Bo, Sierra Leone.  She is 23 years old and married with one child, aged 3. Fatmata sells palm oil and works six days a week, nine hours each day at her business.  She wants to use the loan to purchase more palm oil to grow her business.  She says that sometimes business is difficult.  She wishes to increase her business and help pay for her child.  She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more palm oil

loans.name: Kumba

texts.en: Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 36 year old Kumba from Torkpoi Town in Bo, located in the southern region of the country. She is married with two children, the youngest being 10 years old. Kumba owns a cafe where she works for nine hours every day, six days a week. She requested the loan to buy more rice, pure water and cigarettes for her business to sell. She started her business to engage herself and not depend on others. Before this she was a housewife. She says that sometimes business is difficult. She hopes to see her business expand and help pay for her child.  She greatly appreciates your support!

loans.use: to buy more rice, pure water and cigarettes for her business to sell

loans.name: Paulino

texts.es:
Paulino, de 42 años es un hombre trabajador. Vive en compañía de su esposa Juana y sus 4 hijos a los que cuida en la casa que compró hace 12 años. En las mañanas se dedica a manejar su mototaxi, “en días de cosecha dejó de trabajar en el trasporte y me voy a la chacra, el vehículo me ayuda en transportarme”, afirma. Ya que su principal actividad económica se centra en la agricultura, posee sus propios terrenos agrícolas a varias horas de su hogar, por lo que sale muy temprano a trabajar. Tiene 20 años de experiencia y aprendió este oficio cuando era aun un niño, “sembraba y tenía mis animales, pero me trasladé a vivir en la ciudad por los estudios de mis hijos, dejé de dedicarme a la agricultura, ahí obtuve mi motocarro, ahora comencé a sembrar nuevamente, pues ya tengo el capital que necesitaba”, afirma. Esta muy agradecido con el apoyo económico que le brinda nuestra empresa razon por la cual se compromete a ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas, ya que le enseñarón a ser responsable.
Paulino, invertirá los 800.00 soles  en la compra de abono orgánico para distribuir entre sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Paulino, 42 years old, is a hardworking man. He lives with his wife, Juana, and their four children in a house they bought 12 years ago. In the mornings, Paulino works as a taxi driver, "On harvesting days, I stop working in transportation and I take my vehicle to the farm," he affirms. 

Since his principal source of income is farming, Paulino has his own plots of land located a few hours away from his house. For this reason, he leaves very early in the morning to work. He has 20 years of experience since he learned this trade when he was a young boy. "I farmed and had my own animals, but I moved to the city so that my children could study. I stopped working in agriculture and obtained by vehicle. I am beginning to work in agriculture again, now that I have the capital that I needed." 

Paulino is very grateful for the financial support he receives from this communal bank. He promises to be punctual with his repayments since he has already learned the importance of being responsible. 

Paulino will invest the 800 soles to buy organic fertilizer for his crops.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Neomi

texts.en: This is 50 year old Neomi from Bo, Sierra Leone in the southern region of the country. She is married with four children. She owns a business that sells coal and drinks in Torkpoi Town. She was a housewife before and started the business to engage herself.  She works at her business for six hours a day, seven days a week.  She says that sometimes business is tough. She requested the loan to purchase more cool drinks to grow her business. In the next five years, she would like to see the business continue to expand and improve. She greatly appreciates your support!

loans.use: to purchase more drinks to grow her business

loans.name: Almast

texts.en:
Almast is engaged in agriculture. She keeps four cows and 80 sheep. Almast has been involved in agriculture for more than fifteen years, and it has become a part of her life. She breeds cattle to get milk which she uses in cheese production. Due to her hard work, her cheese is in strong demand among the buyers. Almast works hard to meet her clients' demand and sustain her family. As agriculture helps Almast to get income and cover her family's daily costs she would like to expand the business. Almast has applied for this loan to purchase two bulls and forage for feeding the livestock.
The loan is very important for her to increase her livestock, feed the animals and earn more income. Almast lives with her husband and 19-year-old daughter. Almast does her best to ensure a better life for her husband and daughter.

loans.use: To pay for two bulls and forage for feeding the livestock.

loans.name: Tigidanky

texts.en: This is Tigidanky from Torkpoi Town in Bo, in the south of Sierra Leone.  She is married with six children, the youngest being eight years old. Her husband is a laborer and also contributes to the family. Tigidanky owns a business that sells personal items such as creams, soaps and toothpaste.  She works eight hours per day, seven days per week in her business.  She requested this loan to purchase more inventory to expand her business.  She hopes to see her business continue to grow in the future.  She greatly appreciates your support!

loans.use: to purchase more inventory such as creams, soaps and toothpaste

loans.name: Banco Mujer En Progreso Group

texts.es: Yesenia es la tesorera de Banco Mujer En Progreso, tiene 32 años, 3 hijos menores de edad y vive en unión libre hace más de 7 años. Ella es una comerciante con mucha experiencia y a través de los años ha logrado consolidar su negocio y aumentar su cartera de clientas.  Su actividad es la distribución al por mayor de recipientes plásticos de cocina, y también la venta ambulante de los mismos artículos por unidad. Este es el cuarto crédito que solicita y nos cuenta que los financiamientos de Fundación Mujer son los que le permitieron fortalecer su negocio.  Y este préstamo será invertido en los mismos recipientes plásticos que se vende muy bien. Entre sus proyectos están seguir creciendo y distribuir en otras comunidades los productos, aumentar sus ingresos económicos y con ello mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. El grupo lo integran un total de 9 señoras que van a invertir en actividades comerciales.
texts.en:
Yesenia is the treasurer of Banco Mujer En Progreso (Women in Progress Bank). She is 32 years old and has three young children. She has been civilly married for more than seven years. Yesenia is a saleswoman with much experience. Over the years, she has been able to strengthen her business and increase her clients. She works selling plastic kitchen containers in bulk as well as individually in door-to-door sales. 

This is Yesenia's fourth loan. She says that the loans from Fundación Mujer (Women's Foundation) have helped her to strengthen her business. Yesenia will invest this loan to purchase more of the plastic containers that are in higher demand. She plans to continue growing and selling her products in other communities. She aims to increase her profits, and thus improve her family's quality of life. 

This group is composed of nine women who will invest in other businesses as well.

loans.use: to buy plastic kitchen containers to sell in bulk.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Please meet Margaret from Torkpoi Town in Bo, Sierra Leone.  She is 38 years old and married with four children, aged 4 to 22.  All four of her children currently attend school. Margaret operates a business six days per week selling palm oil, gari and wood from her house. She started her business to improve herself and educate her children.  She says that getting a vehicle to take her while she is carrying her inventory is difficult and is a challenge she faces in the business.  She requested this loan to purchase more palm oil, wood and gari for her business.  In five years, she hopes to be able to own her own shop. She wants to use the profits from her business to educate her children and provide for her family.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil, wood and gari for her business

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en:
This is 29-year-old Christiana from Sierra Leone. She is married with 3 children, all between the ages of 2 and 9.  Two of her children are going to school. 
Christiana has a business that sells foodstuff such as palm oil, groundnuts, onions, and peppers in Torkpoi Town in Bo. She works at her business 9 hours a day, 6 days a week. She started her business to engage herself so that she does not need to depend on others. She says that her main challenge is transportation.

She wants to use the loan to purchase more stock including okra, palm oil, peppers, and sesame. With the extra income from the business, she wants to educate her children and grow her business. She greatly appreciates your support.

loans.use: to purchase more stock including okra, palm oil, pepper, and sesame

loans.name: Mamie

texts.en:
Greetings from Bo, Sierra Leone!  Please meet 48-year-old Mamie from Torkpoi Town in Bo, located in the southern part of the country. She is married and has four children, with the youngest one being 7 years old.  

Mamie sells wood, charcoal and palm oil from her house. She works 12 hours per day, 5 days per week at her business. She started her business to help educate her children. She says that the cost of transportation and her inventory are major challenges for her business.

She requested the loan to purchase more wood, palm oil and charcoal for her business. She hopes to continue to see the business grow and use the proceeds to pay her children’s school fees.  

Mamie wants to say a big thank you to BRAC and Kiva for helping the women of Sierra Leone.

loans.use: to purchase more wood, palm oil and charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Jeneba

texts.en:
Please meet 48-year-old Jeneba from Torkpoi Town in Bo, Sierra Leone. She is married and has four children, two of whom are currently going to school. 
 
Jeneba owns a business selling fish and oil. She works nine hours a day, five days a week at her business. She started her business to engage herself and educate her children. She requested the loan to buy more fish and oil.  

She says that transportation is a big challenge. At times, the vehicle will break down on the way, and she will need to sleep by the road until the next day to find her way back. With the loan, she hopes to increase her business and pay her children’s school fees. She greatly appreciates your support!

loans.use: to buy more fish and oil

loans.name: Augusta H.

texts.en:
This is 49-year-old Augusta from Torkpoi Town in Bo, Sierra Leone. She is married with four children, between the ages of nine and 24. Three of her children currently attend school.

Augusta sells rubber and wood from her house and works seven hours a day, five days a week at her business. She started her business to improve herself and to educate her children. She requested the loan to buy more stock, such as rubber and wood, for her business. She says that transportation is high, and the prices of wood and rubber rise and fall, making her business more unpredictable.  

The client wants to use the proceeds of her business to feed her family and pay her children’s school fees. She thanks you for helping her business improve.

loans.use: to buy more stock, such as rubber and wood, for her business

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is a 38-year-old widow with three children.

Analyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 28,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, spices, egg, sugar, soft drinks, etc.

Analyn has borrowed and paid back 20 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from a rice retail business.

Analyn successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store and rice retailing business.

Analyn aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, spices, egg, sugar, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza works hard to support her family. She is married and has a banana business in the Philippines. Analiza has requested a loan of 12,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional stocks of bananas to sell. She has been in this business for 10 years now.
In the future, Analiza would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of bananas to sell

loans.name: Renny Boy

texts.en:
Renny is 39 years of age and lives in Sominot Zamboanga del Sur. He is married with two children.
Renny has a pig raising business. He earns about 20,000 PHP every four months from the business. Renny has requested a loan to purchase more pigs.
Renny has been a member of Paglaum MPC for one year. In the future, Renny hopes to have a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase more pigs for his piggery business

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina is married with four children. She is 42 years of age and lives in Purok Makiangayon Blancia Molave, Zamboanga del Sur.
Marcelina sells dried fish to earn a living and has had this business for 13 years. Each month, she earns 3,700 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to to purchase more dried fish for her retail business. 

Marcelina has been a member of Paglaum MPC for almost one year. In the future, Marcelina hopes to expand her business and become successful.

loans.use: to purchase more dried fish for her retail business

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza is 56 years old and lives in San Isidro, Jimenez,  Misamis Occidental. She is married with three children. 

Liza has a general store and earns approximately 3,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to  purchase more stock for her general store such as shampoo, toothpaste, soap, salt, and vinegar.

Liza has been a member of PMPC for almost six years. In the future, Liza hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more stock for her general store such as shampoo, toothpaste, soap, salt, and vinegar.

loans.name: Elna Fe

texts.en:
Elna Fe is 28 years old and lives in Cabangcalan, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with two children.

To earn a living, Elna Fe has an eatery business. She earns about 4,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. Elna Fe has requested a loan to purchase more raw  ingredients for her eatery business.

Elna Fe became a member of PMPC this year. In the future, Elna Fe would like to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more raw  ingredients for her eatery business.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion is 56 years old, married with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Concepcion has a general store business in the Philippines. She has requested a loan of 28,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional stocks such as soap, canned goods, milk, sugar and coffee.

Concepcion has been in this business for six years. In the future, Concepcion would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks such as soap, canned goods, milk, sugar and coffee.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more kitchen wares to sell

loans.name: Lerma

texts.en:
Lerma is married with seven children. Lerma is 50 years old and lives in Poblacion, Titay, Zamboanga Sibugay.
Lerma owns a general store to earn a living and has had this business for 25 years. Each month, she earns 5000 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 7000 PHP to purchase more stock for her general store such as toothpaste, soaps and shampoo. Lerma has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store  such as toothpaste, soaps and shampoo

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 47 years old and lives in Antonino, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with three children.
Myrna works in the fish industry and sells fish for a living. She has been doing this for five years. She has requested a loan to purchase more fish to sell.
Myrna has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Myrna hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

location.town: Liloy - Antonino, Labason, Zamboanga Del Norte

loans.name: Cecil

texts.en:
Cecil is married with one child. Cecil is 33 years old and lives in Antonino, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte.
Cecil sells clothes to earn a living and had this business for 13 years. Each month, he earns 20,000 PHP doing this type of work. He has requested a loan of 30,000 PHP to purchase more clothes for his retail business. Cecil joined PMPC this year. In the future, Cecil hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes for his retail business

location.town: Liloy - Antonino, Labason, Zamboanga Del Norte

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie is 53 years old and lives in Antonino, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with eight children. Rosie works in the fish industry and sells fish for a living. She has been doing this for 30 years. She has requested a loan to purchase more fish to sell in her retail business.
Rosie has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Rosie hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell in her retail business.

location.town: Liloy - Antonino, Labason, Zamboanga Del Norte

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Divina requested a loan of 13,000 PHP through NWTF to buy items to sell such as soap, sugar, milk, spices, eggs and noodles. Divina has been in this business for two years. In the future, Divina would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as soap, sugar, milk, spices, eggs and noodles.

loans.name: Marco Antonio

texts.es:
Marco es un hombre muy trabajador, tiene 40 años pero tiene la vitalidad de un joven de 20 años, ya que el trabajo es su herramienta para vivir lleno de vitalidad, la vivienda donde habita Marco se encuentra en la ciudad de Ica, ciudad que cuenta con muchos atractivos turísticos y se puede apreciar la agricultura en especial el cultivo de algodón, paprika, esparrago, entre otros. Marco una razón muy importante para luchar cada día y esa es su familia, el vive al lado de su esposa y de sus hijos a quienes ama muchísimo y a pesar de las adversidades que la vida le ha presentado sigue unido más que nunca a su familia. Debido a sus pocos recursos económicos Marco solo pudo estudiar hasta el quinto grado de secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar la carrera de Medicina Humana.

Día a día Marco lucha para sacar a su familia adelante y lo hace con su pequeño y humilde negocio e lavado de autos, el trabaja alrededor de 10 horas al día y puede atender hasta 10 clientes de manera diaria; él cree que está saliendo adelante en su negocio porque es amable con los clientes y porque su familia es el motor y la mejor motivación de lucha.

Marco está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le están brindando el podrá comprar un nuevo triciclo para cargar los baldes de agua que utiliza para lavar los autos, así como también una sillas nuevas para poder ofrecer una mejor comodidad a sus clientes ya que las que tiene actualmente son viejas, así podrá mejorar cada día y seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener su casa propia y ofrecerles una buena educación a sus hijos”.
texts.en:
Marco is a very hardworking man.  He's 40 but has the vitality of a 20-year-old young man because work is his tool to live full of vitality.  The house where Marco lives is in the city of Ica, where there are a lot of tourist attractions and agriculture, especially cotton, paprika, asparagus, and other crops.

One very important reason for Marco to strive every day is his family.  He lives with his wife and children, whom he loves a lot.  Despite the adversities he has faced in life, he continues to be closer than ever to his family.  Because of his scarce economic resources Marco only managed to study  up to the fifth year of secondary school, but he would like to have studied the field of human medicine.

Every day Marco strives to get his family ahead, which he does with his small and modest car-washing business.  He works about 10 hours a day and can serve up to 10 customers.  He believes he's getting ahead in his business because he's friendly with the customers and because his family is the driving force and best motivation for striving.

Marco is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because thanks to their help he'll be able to buy a new tricycle to carry the pails of water he uses to wash the cars.  He'll also buy some new chairs so his customers will be more comfortable because the ones he has now are old.

This way he'll be able to improve every day and continue striving to be able to make his biggest dream a reality: "To have his own house and to give his children a good education."

loans.use: to buy a tricycle

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is 50, married, and has one child. She lives in Lumbayao, Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte.

Flora sells bananas to earn a living, and had this business for 20 years. Each month, she earns 10,000 PHP doing this. She has requested a loan of 14,900 PHP to purchase more bananas to sell. Flora has been a member of PMPC for three years. 

In the future, Flora hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more bananas to sell.

loans.name: Jane's Group

texts.en:
Jane’s group comprises five women who are mostly widows.  Their average age is 40 years, and each has four children. They all live in the same village – Kyakatebe - and they are active members of YICE's women self-help groups in that village. All members in this group are small-scale farmers, growing vegetables like tomatoes, eggplants, onions, and green peppers for sale in their village market.

Jane (first from left), is 41 years old and she has been this group leader for one year. She earns her income through sales of her vegetables, although she believes that reaps less than expected due to poor-quality yields.

Jane and her group members attended YICE’s farming-as-business trainings and acquired skills to increase her vegetable quality and yields. She now asks for a loan to buy good quality vegetable seeds and fertilizers and also to access more training on vegetable production to increase her yields, earn extra income, and position herself to take good care of her family.

Jane has a dream of becoming a model farmer for vegetable growing in her village.

loans.use: To buy good quality vegetable seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides

loans.name: Resty’S Group

texts.en:
The female members of Resty’s group have all attended YICE trainings in farming-as-a-business. They belong to YICE’s female self-help group of Kyakatebe II village.  These women live in the same village, and because they have no money to pay for workers in their gardens, they offer group labor on a member’s garden in a revolving model. They all grow beans and maize, and they also rear pigs.

The leader of this group is Resty (first from left); she is 39 years old and married with four children. Resty has earned her income by growing maize and beans for the last 10 years, but she always yields less than expected.

She is applying for this loan to buy good quality seeds and fertilizers and to expand her maize and bean gardens. She intends to use her increased income from her yields to pay for school fees of her children and also establish a small retail shop in her village.

Resty has a dream of opening up a retail shop in her village so as to supplement her income.

loans.use: To buy good quality maize, bean seeds, and fertilizers

loans.name: Edwin

texts.es: Edwin, de 30 años es un hombre trabajador y muy alegre. Vive en compañía de su esposa Sarita con quien tiene 2 hijos: Judith y Guillermo, con quienes vive en la casa de su tía desde hace 4 años. Desde los 18 años trabajó sin descanso en la agricultura, pues siempre cuidó de sus padres. Cuando formó su propia familia pensó en obtener ingresos constantes y poder vivir en la ciudad, razón por la cual compro su mototaxi , desde entonces trabaja sin descanso durante todos el día , ya que desea tener su casa propia. Durante estos años le fue bien, tanto así que compró otro motocarro más , con el que enseñó a manejar a su esposa y poder juntos trabajar en el trasporte de personas por los alrededores de la ciudad, ahora trabaja mucho más por lo que tiene que brindarle mantenimiento constante a amabos mototaxis, espera poder seguir ahorrando y comprar más mototaxis, su sueño es abrir su propia empresa de trasporte. En esta oportunidad solictará S/.500 soles para la compra de llantas nuevas y una toldera para mejorar su motortaxi , a su vez se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de maneral puntual y responsable.
texts.en: Edwin, age 30, is a hard-working and very cheerful man. He lives in the company of his wife, Sarita, with whom he has 2 children, Judith and Guillermo. Together with them, he has lived in the home of his aunt for 4 years. Since he was 18, he worked tirelessly in agriculture, since he always took care of his parents. When he started his own family, he thought about obtaining a steady income and being able to live in the city, and for that reason he bought his moto-taxi. Since then, he has been working without rest every day, since he wants to have a house of his own. During these years, it has gone so well for him that he bought another moto-cart, and he taught his wife to drive it, so that they could work together to transport people around the city. Now he works much more, since he has to provide constant maintenance for both moto-taxis. He hopes that he will be able to continue saving and to buy more moto-taxis. His dream is to start his own transportation company. On this occasion, he is requesting 500 soles to buy new tires and a canopy to improve his moto-taxi. In turn, he is committed to making his loan payments punctually and responsibly.

loans.use: to buy tires and a canopy for a moto-taxi.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more food supplements and herbal medicines to resell.

loans.name: Gertrude's Group

texts.en:
Gertrude (pictured first from right) is the featured borrower and leader of this group. She joined her other group members to apply for a loan because they are neighbors and friends, and they all belong to YICE’s female self-help group in Nkokooma village. All the group members are farmers who grow different crops for food and sale.

Getrude is a 27-year-old single mother of one, a child she had when in secondary school, which she had to leave before graduating. Since 2008, Gertrude has grown tomatoes and Irish potatoes to earn a living and care for her daughter. 

Gertrude and her group members were trained by YICE in better farming skills, and as a result they want to put into practice the skills they acquired. 

A small loan of $70 will enable Gertrude to buy good quality seeds and pay for laborers to clear her land for expansion.

Gertrude has a dream of educating her daughter up to University level.

loans.use: To buy good quality seeds and pay for casual laborers to clear fresh land for garden expansion

loans.name: Rose's Group

texts.en:
Rose’s group consists of five married women who on average are 35 years old, have four children, live in the same village, and are friends. All group members rear local chickens and pigs. They also grow food crops. Rose’s group members attained training on better pig rearing skills and they all belong to YICE self-help women groups in Mirembe village.

Rose (second from right) is the group leader and is 39 years old. She is married with four children, all of who attend school. Rose has been rearing pigs for the last two years, but she confessed that her pigs had a slow growth rate and she always lost them to disease and parasites. 

After acquiring skills on better pig rearing practices, Rose plans to expand her project and buy an exotic male pig as a step towards rearing exotic, fast-growing pigs. 

She is therefore applying for this loan to buy an exotic pig, feed, and medicine.

Rose has a dream of establishing a big piggery business and buying cows to produce milk for her children and family.

loans.use: To buy exotic pigs, feed, and medicine for piggery businesses

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en:
Jonathan is 52 years old and lives in Causwagan, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte.  He is married and has three children.

Jonathan buys and sells charcoal to earn a living and he has had this business for 10 years.  Each month, he earns 10,000 PHP doing this type of work.  He has requested a loan of 40,000 PHP in order to purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell and to deliver.

Jonathan has been a member of PMPC for two years.  In the future, Jonathan hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell and to deliver

loans.name: Joyce’S Group

texts.en:
Joyce and her friends formed a group of five to help themselves share farming problems and seek solutions together as a team. They all live in the same village, grow the same crops, and belong to YICE’s female self-help group in Kanyogoga village. 

Joyce (first from right) is 34 years old, with three children who are all in school. Joyce was selected by her friends as the group leader because of her literacy abilities. Joyce has grown sweet potatoes and maize for the last ten years, using the traditional farming methods in her community.

She has requested a loan of $70 to help her buy good quality maize seeds and fertilizers and to access more training on better maize farming practices in order to harvest high yields. She plans to use the income from increased yields to pay school fees for her children and care for her other family needs.

She has a long term plan of buying a big piece of land to expand on her farming activities.

loans.use: To buy good quality maize seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Paskazia’S Group

texts.en:
Paskazia’s group of five women has attended a number of YICE’s trainings in farming and health practices. They are one of the pioneers of YICE’s female self-help groups working together to improve their household incomes through vegetable farming and sales in their village.

Paskazia (in the middle) is the group leader.  She is 44 years old and has five children. She used to grow potatoes, maize, and beans, and in 2011 she changed to growing fast-growing vegetables like tomatoes, onions, and eggplants. She sells her produce in two market villages. Paskazia highlighted soil fertility and vegetable pests as major challenges to her project.

She therefore asks for a loan to buy fertilizers and pesticides to improve her vegetable produce. She plans to use her income from the sale of produce to expand her farm.

She has a dream of setting up a model vegetable farm from which other women would learn and become motivated to grow vegetables.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pesticides for their vegetable gardens

loans.name: Iluminada

texts.en:
Iluminada is 48 years old.  She is married and has six children, two of whom attend school.  She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Iluminada has a basket making business in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for 25 years.  Iluminada has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP through NWTF in order to purchase additional materials like bamboo, wire, etc. to be used for her business.

In the future, Iluminada would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like bamboo, wire, etc.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is married and has two children.  She is 45 years old and lives in Bacolod, Ozamiz City. 

She raises pigs to earn a living and she has been in business for five years.  Each month, she earns 1,000 PHP doing this type of work.  She has requested a loan to purchase more pigs for her piggery business. 

Editha has been a member of Paglaum MPC for two years.  In the future, Editha hopes to expand her business and become successful.

loans.use: to purchase more pigs.

loans.name: Iren

texts.en:
Iren works hard to support her family.  She is married and has a business, buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines.  Iren has been in this business for two years now.  Iren has requested a loan of 13,000 PHP through NWTF in order to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

In the future, Iren would like to build and expand her business in order to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Nuriam

texts.en:
Nuriam is 50 years old, and married.  She lives in Camul, Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte.

Nuriam owns a general store, and has had this business for one year. Each month, she earns 10,000  PHP  with this work.  She has requested a loan of 30,000 PHP to purchase more stock for her general store, such as shampoo, toothpaste, soap, vinegar, and salt.

Nuriam has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store such as shampoo, toothpaste, soap, vinegar, and salt.

location.town: Liloy- Camul, Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is 59 years old and lives in Nacional, Jimenez,  Misamis Occidental. She is married, with two children. 

Leonila is engaged in a food, snack processing, and vending business, and earns approximately PHP 5,000 each month.  She has requested a loan to  purchase additional flour, sugar, other ingredients, and utensils for her for food, snack processing, and vending business. 

Leonila has been a member of PMPC for almost nine years. In the future, Leonila hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional flour, sugar, other ingredients, and utensils for her food business.

loans.name: Pedrita

texts.en:
Pedrita is 62 years old, and lives in Mialem, Jimenez,  Misamis Occidental.  She is married, with two children. 

Pedrita is engaged in the sand and gravel quarrying, and in a snack vending business.  She earns approximately PHP 3,000 each month doing this type of work. 

She has requested a loan to purchase additional sand and gravel for construction delivery.  She has been a member of PMPC for almost five years. 

In the future, Pedrita hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional sand and gravel for construction delivery.

loans.name: María De La Paz

texts.es:
La señora María, tiene 53 años de edad, vive junto una hija  de 27 años de edad,  sus nietas una niña de 4 años de edad y un niño de 2 años de edad y el esposo de la hija; también, vive con ellas la mamá la señora María de 70 años de edad.

Desde hace 5 años dejó de trabajar en las actividades de comercio de frutas y elaboración de tortillas, manifestó que de esta actividad creció sus hijos, un hermano  y 1 nieto, quines hoy son adultos. Actualmente, no trabaja, se dedica a realizar labores domesticas y del cuidado de los nietos y la mamá;  dependen económicamente de los ingresos de la hija quien es bachiller con lo que logró  obtener el empleo de conserje en el teatro nacional en la ciudad y de la remesa familiar que le envía el hermano desde Estados Unidos para el cuidado de la mamá.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar 600 bloques de cemento, 4 quintales de hierr0, 20 bolsas de cemento, 600  de tejas de barro y madera;  para pagar la mano de obra en la construcción y ampliación de la vivienda. Con la inversión, tendrá una vivienda digna y mejoras aspectos sobre la salud al evitar el hacinamiento.  Con  el objetivo de tener un mejor confort familiar y distribución de los  espacios dentro de la vivienda.
texts.en:
María is 53 years old and lives with her daughter who is 27 years old and her granddaughters, a little girl who is 4 years old and a little boy who is 2 years old. Her daughter's husband and Maria's mother, who is 70 years old, also live with them.  

For 5 years Maria has worked selling fruit and making tortillas. This work sustained her in bringing up her children, a brother and a grandchild, who are now adults. At present she is not working but carries household duties and looks after her grandchildren and her mum. The are financially dependent on her daughter's income. Her daughter graduated from high school and in this way managed to obtain employment as a concierge at the national theatre of the city and also from the remittance her brother sends from the United States to look after her mother.  

She is asking Fundación Campo, for a loan to buy 600 blocks of cement, 4 one-hundred kilogram packages of iron, 20 bags of cement, 600 mud and wood roof-tiles and to pay labour costs for construction and expansion of her home. Thanks to this investment she will have a dignified home and better conditions for her health by avoiding over-crowding. Her aim is for her family to live more comfortably with a better distribution of space within the home.

loans.use: to buy 600 blocks of cement, 4 one-hundred kilogram packages of iron, 20 bags of cement, 600 mud and wood roof-tiles and to pay labour costs for construction and expansion of her home.

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Clarita is 55 years old and lives in Sibaroc, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with five children. 

Clarita is engaged in a gardening business and earns approximately PHP 5,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to purchase commercial fertilizer and seeds for her gardening activity.

Clarita has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase commercial fertilizer and seeds for her gardening activity.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 43 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Jocelyn runs a buy and sell charcoal business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell. She has been in this business for two years.

In the future, Jocelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Pablita

texts.en:
Pablita is married and has seven children. She is 62 years old and lives in Kinangay Norte, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. 

For the past 30 years, Pablita has operated a general store, buying and selling firewood and white wine. She has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase canned goods, soft drinks, sacks of rice, and additional stock for her firewood business.

Pablita has been a member of PMPC for one year and four months. In the future, she hopes to be successful in her chosen business.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, sacks of rice, and additional firewood.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes works hard to support her family. Lourdes is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Lourdes requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like spices, soap, canned goods, noodles, eggs, etc.

Lourdes has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Lourdes would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy items to sell like spices, soap, canned goods, noodles, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is Fatmata from Kulanda Town in Bo, located in the southern part of the country. She is 36 years old and married with three children, the youngest being 8 years old. Two of her children are currently going to school. 

Fatmata has a business selling refrigerator parts, copper rods, pans, and wood, as well as water and drinks. She works 11 hours per day, 6 days per week at her business. She started this business because she was alone and had to take care of her family. 

Fatmata requested this loan to purchase more inventory to expand the water-and-drinks side of her business. 

She hopes that in five years time, she sees her child be the first in the family to go to university. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory such as water and drinks.

loans.name: Marisa

texts.en:
This loan will help Marisa renovate her restaurant and continue to cook for her community.

Embracing her Mexican roots, Marisa, a first-generation U.S. citizen looking for a means to support her family, began her own catering business in 1995. In 2002, Marisa opened her own restaurant, Tijuana’s Mexican Kitchen, in the heart of Lincoln Park, Michigan. Now, Marisa’s business is thriving and the entire family is working together to run three different locations throughout the Metro Detroit area. 

Marisa loves being able to pursue her passion of cooking every day while also being able to provide for her family both in the U.S. and in Mexico. She is happy that her own entrepreneurial endeavor has become a family business that will be passed on to her children and grandchildren. 

Marisa needs a loan to renovate one of her restaurants, purchase a new air conditioner and floor for the dining room, and to help maintain and expand her large catering order contracts.

View Tijuana’s Mexican Kitchen at http://www.tijuanasmexicankitchen.com/

loans.use: To purchase a new air conditioner and floor for the restaurant and to expand her catering contracts

loans.name: Ma. Eden

texts.en:
Ma. Eden, a 61-year-old mother of five children, all married, lives with her husband in the village of Bantug Petines. Engaged in a hog-raising business for 10 years, she earns PHP 4,500 every four to five months.

Ma. Eden is requesting a loan of PHP 35,000 to buy feed, vaccine and an additional hog to raise. She hopes that she can obtain her desired loan to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccine, and an additional hog to raise.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is 30 years old and married. She is now applying for a loan of $1,000 to improve her business. She opened her kiosk one year ago with her own working capital of $500. She earns a good income from her business.

Veronica will use her loan to buy some stock, such as rice and cigarettes, to keep in her store. She is a very hardworking woman in doing business. 

She wants to make her business bigger and improve her living conditions in the future.

loans.use: to buy rice and cigarettes.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es: Ana María, tiene 45 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 3 hijos y vive en el municipio de Esparta, Atlántida. Ella tiene su propio negocio de pulpería en su casa donde vende productos alimenticios como arroz, frijoles, manteca, jabón, azúcar, harina y otros.  Para mantener activo su negocio ha invertido en varios prestamos, con el que solicita actualmente  es el quinto ciclo y es por 21,000 Lempiras, con el cual va comprar granos básicos, manteca,  jabón, azúcar, harina etc. Para surtir el negocio y atender mejor al cliente. Su meta es crecer con el negocio y obtener mejores ganancias para el bienestar familiar.
texts.en:
Ana María is 45 years of age and a single mother. She has three children, and lives in the town of Esparta, Atlántida. She has her own grocery business which she runs from home, and sells products such as rice, beans, lard, soap, sugar, flour and other items. 

To keep her business going, Ana María has invested through a number of loans. This is her fifth loan cycle, and she has requested 21,000 Lempiras to buy basic grains, lard, soap, sugar, flour and other items. This will allow her to supply her business and better meet her customers’ needs. Her goal is to see her business grow, and to obtain better income to provide for her family’s wellbeing.

loans.use: To buy food products such as basic grains, lard, sugar, and other items to supply her grocery store.

loans.name: Leonisa

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Leonisa works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transportation business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Leonisa is borrowing PHP 28,000 through NWTF to buy spare parts for her motorcycle.

Leonisa has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her motorcycle

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en: Vilma is married and has three children. She is 40 years old and lives in Cogon, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. For the past year, Vilma has operated a general store and her husband operates a sidecar motor. She has requested a loan of 30,000 PHP to purchase a sidecar motor franchise for her and a renewal of her drivers license. Vilma has been a member of PMPC for two years and eight months. In the future, she hopes to be successful in her chosen business.

loans.use: to purchase a sidecar motor franchise and renew her drivers license

location.town: Ozamis-P1 Cogon, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental,

loans.name: María Víctorina

texts.es:
María tiene 41 años de edad, esta acompañada y tiene cuatro hijos. Desde los 10 años de edad, su madre le enseño a hilar mezcal, ella inicio a elaborar hamacas de maguey, pitas, matatas; con el paso del tiempo empezó a elaborar hamacas con hilo de seda y poliseda. Ahora ella le enseña a sus hijos a hilar las hamacas. Su esposo, por la mañana trabaja en la agricultura y por la tarde se dedica a hilar hamacas.

Los insumos para elaborar las hamacas, las adquiera en una ciudad que esta a diez minutos, a veces se transporta en un vehiculo y en otras caminando, pues no hay transporte publico. Viaja cada 15 o 22 días y lo hace en compañía de su esposo o de un hijo. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando  Fundacion Campo, es para comprar arena y cemento para terminar de construir un muro de contención para la vivienda, ya que en invierno se lava, también comprara 50 libras de hilo y el resto lo invertirá en insumos para sacar agua de un pozo que esta construyendo, ya que en su casa no hay agua potable y actualmente la esta comprando a personas particulares. Así, ella poseerá insumos para seguir elaborando las hamacas y satisfaciendo la demanda de sus clientes. También, contara con una vivienda más segura para su familia. Ella, sueña con seguir mejorando su vivienda enladrillándola con cemento y arena.
texts.en:
María is 42 years old.  She is a common-law wife and has four children.  When she was ten years old, her mother taught her how to weave with mezcal.* She began weaving hammocks and matatas (canvas bags) from maguey* and pita*. Eventually, she began making hammocks with silk thread and poly silk.  Now, she is teaching her children how to weave hammocks.  Her husband works in farming in the morning and weaves hammocks in the evening.

She buys the supplies for making the hammocks in a city that is ten minutes away.  Sometimes she travels by car and other times she walks because there is no public transportation.  She travels every fifteen to twenty days, accompanied by her husband or one of her children.

She is requesting the loan from Fundación Campo to purchase sand and cement to finish building a retaining wall for her home as the previous one was washed away in winter.  She will also buy fifty pounds of yarn and she will invest the remainder in supplies to remove water from a well that she is building.  Her home doesn’t have potable water and she is currently buying it form private individuals.  In this way, she will have the supplies to continue making hammocks and satisfying customer demand.  In addition, she will have a safer home for her family.  Her dream is to continue improving her home and installing brick paving with cement and sand.  

*mescal, maguey, pita – common names for the Agave plant.  The fibers are used in weaving.
(For more information about mezcal and weaving, please visit: http://cookjmex.blogspot.com/2010/10/oaxaca-part-7-mezcal-weaving-two-local.html)

loans.use: to purchase sand and cement for home improvement and 50 pounds of thread for weaving.

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en:
Carolina is 60 years old and lives in Poblacion Mahayag, Zamboanga del Sur. She is married with three children.

Carolina sells cosmetic brands such as Avon, Natasha, and Boardwalk to earn a living and has had this business for 25 years. Each month, She earns 5,000 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to purchase more stock for her cosmetic sales business.

Carolina has been a member of Paglaum MPC for 2 years. In the future, Carolina hopes to increase her income to 10,000 PHP a month and become a successful businesswoman.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her cosmetic sales business selling brands like Avon, Natasha, and Boardwalk

loans.name: Brigida

texts.en: Brigida is engaged in a hog-raising business in the village of Bantug Petines. She is 54 years old and is married. They are blessed with six children. Brigida works hard to support their daily needs and to help her children financially. She wants to develop her business and increase her income. To this end, Brigida wants to borrow PHP 30,000 to buy feed and vaccines for her hog. She is hoping that her loan request will be granted so she can develop her business and purchase more hogs to raise.

loans.use: to buy feed and vaccines for her hog

loans.name: Zoila Del Carmen

texts.es:
Zoila, necesita invertir en el negocio, por eso está solicitando un nuevo préstamo, que le permita realizar la compra de concentrado para los cerdos y además comprara dos cerdos, esto le permitirá que su granja se mantenga.
Con el préstamo anterior ella comenta que le ayudo a mejorar sus ingresos, al mismo tiempo incrementa sus posibilidades de que su familia este mejor, sus condiciones en el hogar está mejorando.
texts.en:
Zoila needs to invest in her business, so she is applying for a new loan which will allow her to buy concentrated feed for her pigs. In addition she will buy two pigs. This will allow her to maintain her farm. 

She says that the previous loan helped her to improve her income, at the same time as increasing her family's chances of being better off.  Their living conditions are improving.

loans.use: to buy pigs and concentrated feed.

loans.name: Jose Santos

texts.es:
José se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo, para surtir más el negocio, realizando la venta de mariscos, granos básicos, dulces, ya que esto mejorara la venta surtiéndose de mas productos, como pescado, camarón, frijoles, dulces.
El efecto que tuvo con el préstamo anterior fue positivo, mejoro el negocio, agrego nuevos rubros, esto le mejoro las ventas, en su familia se mantienen los ingresos con el negocio.
texts.en:
José has decided to take out a new loan to stock up his business selling seafood, basic grains and sweets. This will improve his sales by stocking more products, like fish, shrimp, beans and sweets. 

The effect he had with the previous loan was positive and improved his business. He added new items, which improved sales. With the business, he maintains his family's income.

loans.use: to buy seafood, basic grains and sweets.

loans.name: María Sebastiana

texts.es:
La señora María, tiene 51 años de edad, vive junto a su hijo de 13 años de edad, quien estudia sexto grado, tiene un hijo de 26 años de edad que reside en Estados Unidos, es importante mencionar que ella estuvo casada por  8 meses y que al separarse con el esposo quedó embarazada y que ese niño se le murió al nacer. Los hijos que ella posee son adoptados.

Ella se dedica al comercio de frutas y verduras en el mercado municipal, el que se encuentra a 3 kilómetros de su vivienda. Esta actividad la desempeña,  desde que tiene 19 años de edad; además, es líder en su comunidad y es la presidenta de la asociación de desarrollo comunal, lo que le sirvió para adquirir el trabajo de coordinadora de un programa denominado PATI que se está ejecutando desde el 2011 impulsado por la alcaldía de la ciudad y supervisado por el FISDL. Y consiste en enseñar a jóvenes y adultos mayores en la elaboración de huertos caseros.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para 2 metros cúbicos de arena, 20 bolsas de cemento y pago de mano de obra. Para terminar de construir la cerca perimetral de su vivienda. 

Al concluir la construcción protegerá la inversión hecha, y le servirá de protección y delimitación de su terreno. Uno de sus sueños,  es establecer una pequeña tienda y mejorar las condiciones de la vivienda.
texts.en:
María is 51 years of age and lives with her child aged 13, who is studying in the sixth grade. She has a son aged 26 who resides in the United States. It is important to mention that she was married for 8 months, and when she separated from her husband she was pregnant, and that this child died at birth. The children that she has are adopted.

She works in a fruit and vegetable business, in the local market, which is located 3 kilometres from her home. She has carried out this activity since she was 19 years old. In addition, she is a leader in her community, and is the president of the association of communal development, which she made use of to acquire the job of coordinator of a programme called PATI, which she has carried out since 2011, encouraged by the city mayor's office and supervised by the FISDL (Social Investment Fund for Local Development). This consists of teaching young people and senior citizens about making home vegetable gardens. 

The loan she is applying for from Fundación Campo is for two cubic metres of sand, twenty bags of cement and to pay labour costs. It is to finish the construction of the perimeter wall of her home. 

Completing the construction will protect the investment made, and will serve to protect and delimit her land. One of her dreams is to establish a small shop, and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy two cubic metres of sand, twenty bags of cement and to pay labour costs. It is to finish the construction of the perimeter wall of her home.

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
This is Shirley, 37, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Roderick, a driver and is the mother of their children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. She and her husband are working hard to provide income for their everyday needs.

Shirley maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through the popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fuller life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other direct selling brands. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. The dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalogue, and these are the profits that dealers are using as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 2000 in sales every week.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional supplies and merchandise like shampoo, cologne, deodorant, perfume, soap, fabric softener, undergarments and other products needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Shirley hopes to expand her business and give her children a good future. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional supplies and merchandise like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed in her business.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn is from the village of Gotocan Daku, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 45 years old. Jocelyn is married and has one child in school and one who is married. To make a living, Jocelyn owns and operates a hog raising business. She has been engaged in this business for 5 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month. In 2007, Jocelyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from PMPC. Jocelyn is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase more pigs to sell.

loans.use: to purchase more pigs to sell.

location.town: Ozamis-P2 Gotokan Daku, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occid

loans.name: Silvina

texts.en: Silvina is applying for a loan of $1,000 from Tuba Rai Metin. She is living in a town near the market. She is 20 years old, married, and has one child. She is running a kiosk in the market and she will use this loan to buy stock to keep in her store such as rice. She is making good money from selling and she wants to apply for a bigger loan in the future.

loans.use: to buy rice to sell.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 21,000 Philippine pesos through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like snack foods, eggs, shampoo, canned goods, etc., for her general store business. Helen has been in this business for 10 years. She earns additional income from motorcycle transport.

Helen has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the financial stability of her family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like snack foods, eggs, shampoo, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn is 24 years old and lives in Fatima, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. She is single. To earn a living, Jenelyn has a business selling a variety of foods for snacks. She earns about 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) each month doing this type of work. Jenelyn has a requested a loan to purchase ingredients and food to cook to sell.

Jenelyn has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Jenelyn would like to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients and food to cook to sell

loans.name: Narlie

texts.en:
This is Narlie, 48, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Amor and a mother to their children. She and her husband manage their own household. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Narlie oversees and owns operations of their tricycle transportation business. They have one unit of tricycle that carries up to four passengers to their destination within the community. The tricycle driver then remits a boundary (daily quota) each day to her. In her business, the regular customers are the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 8,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy spare parts and accessories and to pay for the maintenance of her motorcycle. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Narlie hopes to have more tricycles and dreams of giving her children a good life. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts and maintenance of her tricycle unit.

loans.name: Marlene

texts.en:
Marlene is 59 years old and lives in Lutao, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married with five children.
 
Marlene is engaged in a hog-fattening business and earns approximately PHP 3,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to be used to purchase additional sacks of feed for her hog-fattening activity.
 
Marlene has been a member of PMPC for seven years. In the future, Marlene hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional sacks of feed

loans.name: Mercidita

texts.en:
This is Mercidita. She previously accessed an 15,000 PHP loan that she utilized to buy gardening materials and supplies needed for her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy gardening materials like wire baskets and supplies such as seeds and fertilizer needed for her business. Her profits from this business will definitely help her sustain her family's daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Mercidita hopes to have a good life with her family and dreams that her business will get bigger. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer and garden inputs for her business

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
This is Alma, 47, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is already a widow but she has her children to help her in managing their household and operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Alma operates a pineapple farm. She grows pineapple on their farm located in Cavite. It is in the highlands where it is suitable to grow pineapple. She sells her product at the market and at fruit stores that she regularly supplies and to the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 1,000 in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 40,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy fertilizer and farm inputs for her business. Part of the loan will go to the maintenance of her farm. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Alma hopes to expand her business and dreams of giving her children a good life. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for fertilizer and farm inputs

loans.name: Merle

texts.en:
Merle is 55 years old and lives in Nacional, Jimenez,  Misamis Occidental. She is a widow and has two children. 

Merle is engaged in a polvoron (shortbread pastry) making business and earns approximately 3,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional flour, sugar, butter and wrappers for her polvoron making business.
 
Merle has been a member of PMPC for 1 year. In the future, Merle hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional flour, sugar, butter and wrappers

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is 61 years old and lives in Matugas Bajo, Jimenez,  Misamis Occidental. She is married and has six children. 

Patricia is engaged in a fish vending business and earns approximately 1,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional kilos of fish to sell. 

Patricia has been a member of PMPC for almost 7 years. In the future, Patricia hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional kilos of fish to sell

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en: Hilda is a 41-year-old married woman and a mother of three children from Loon, Bohol. She had been running a sari-sari or variety store business for more than two years now. She sells various goods and items to the people in her area. Hilda is asking for a loan to buy additional stock of merchandise to sell like canned goods, biscuits, soap, detergents, soda and beverages. With this, she will be able to attract and cater to more buyers in her store. Hilda dreams of making her business a success in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of merchandise to sell like canned goods, biscuits, soap, detergents, soda and beverages

loans.name: Telfilo

texts.en: Telfilo, 37 years of age, is married and blessed with two children. He has owned and operated a retail store in the village of Union for almost eight years. He's earning a net income of PHP 4,000 every month. He would like a loan of PHP 20,000 to purchase canned goods, biscuits, curls, and beverages. He's hoping that his loan will be granted so that he can earn a higher profit.

loans.use: To purchase canned goods, biscuits, curls, and beverages

loans.name: Marvin

texts.en: Hog-raising is Marvin's primary source of income. He has been in this business for a year. He is married to Marivic, who helps him to manage their business. Right now, he is asking for a loan in the amount of 30,000 PHP to buy additional hogs to raise and feed for them. Marvin hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy additional hogs to raise and feed for them

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
This is Lourdes, 50, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Lauro, her business partner and a mother to her children. She and her husband are managing their household while operating the business. They are working hand in hand to provide income for their everyday expenses.

Lourdes owns and oversees operations of their jeepney (see footnote) transportation business. She has one unit (14-16 person capacity) jeepney, for which they are paid a boundary (daily quota) each day. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 1,000 every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 50,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy spare parts and pay for the maintenance of her jeepney unit. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Lourdes hopes to have more capital for her growing business and dreams of having a good and peaceful life. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

-Curiously, Jeepneys have purely American origins. They were first used by American soldiers helping the Philippines throw off the invading Japanese. Filipino ingenuity, however, managed to see this vehicle as an opportunity to earn, and modified the Jeep into a 20-seater jeepney, open enough to provide adequate ventilation, sturdy for every day travel, and cheap enough to buy and maintain. Now, the jeepneys are one of the things that makes the Philippines truly Philippines.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts and maintenance of their jeepney unit.

loans.name: Benedicta

texts.en:
This is Benedicta. She previously accessed an 15,000 PHP loan that she utilized to buy gardening materials and supplies needed for her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 25,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy gardening materials like wire, baskets and supplies such as seeds and fertilizer needed in her business.
